text:
I travel a lot for work, and everywhere I go, one of the things I search for is a local coffee roaster.

And there it is, sitting right in the front of a warm, cozy, welcoming shop. I had a pour over, which was measured, timed, etc all to the standard I expect of an excellent coffee shop.  

What REALLY makes this place stand out, though, is their cold brew.  It was phenomenal, without a doubt, in the top three iced coffees I've ever had anywhere in this country.  Even black, it had a smooth, velvety creaminess, while still being refreshing and thirst quenching.   I have no idea how they do it.  I've had 24 hour brew. I've had Guatemala (where their current beans were from, I guess).  I've had cold brew that uses that same drip grind size. Nothing NOTHING has been as outstanding as what Smelly Cat puts out.  I'm simply blown away, still, a week later.

Otherwise, cafe space was clean, spacious, cute with mismatching chairs and tables, and a stack of board games. Folks were sitting both inside and out, and (gasp) conversing with each other instead of having their heads stuck in laptops. 

The staff were beyond friendly, kind, and helpful in suggesting places to check out in the neighborhood.  If I'm ever back in Charlotte, I'll be at this place in a heartbeat to try their cortados, shots, and whatever else they can do.

A lovely place. Great coffee, especially the cold brew! The staff is always delightful and friendly. Love the outdoor seating.  The inside is cozy and they play good music. This is definitely my favorite little spot to relax in Charlotte.

Been here a bunch of times! The coffee is always on point, everything from the dirty chai, to mocha, both iced and hot. Their breakfast is good too. We've had the different biscuit combos and the burritos (my favorite is the bacon, egg, and cheese). We had the breakfast casserole before it was permanently on the menu, if it's the same one that's on the menu now, it was AMAZING!

My favorite drink: mocha frappe with skim and a squirt of peppermint

Absolutely amazing. Friendly staff, delicious coffee, delicious pastries, and a great experience. Honestly, we planned to just go in and sit down for maybe 5 minutes to have a cup of coffee, but we ended up staying and talking to Cathy for about 45 minutes. You can feel her passion for coffee and for her customers in the way she talks. She walked us through her entire roasting process and even let us taste the coffee beans! It's definitely a welcoming environment, unlike a lot of coffee shops that just want to get you through the line and out the door. 

We had the cuban and cortadito, which were both delicious, and Cathy also gave us samples of both of their nitro cold brews. Having tried them before, I was completely against nitrogen-infused coffee, but theirs will change your mind! Both were very delicious and were infused with just the right amount of nitrogen, not over infused like other places that give it that almost beer-like taste. 

If we lived around here, we would be in here every day!

Not dog friendly as it says here. Did not allow me to bring my service animal into the shop. The cashier had us waiting in order to get a receipt, and there were people outside smoking weed. Originally it had a great feel but it overall was a bad experience. Definitely not Fido friendly.

This little coffee house is my favorite. The only place in Charlotte that offers a Cuban coffee or a Miami Cuban coffee, which are almost the exact same. Every time I am this part of town you will find me here, and always love introducing people to the cute coffee house. I wish I could give it more stars. The employees are outstanding and extremely nice. Love this place.
Friendly people, easy parking. I just got a tea, so I can't vouch for hand crafted drinks, but I'd go back.

Smelly Cat is an okay coffee shop. Maybe everyone else hyped it up to much and my high expectations weren't met, but after going there a couple times nothing really impressed me. Not to say that I ever had a bad experience. The staff has always been nice. The drinks are good, though sometimes they take a while to be made.

The inside of the shop feels a little cramped to me, but I am 6,2 so I could just be me. The interior is dim and comfortable, though they lack an of the nice big sofas some other Charlotte coffee shops have. The outside seating is sparse and the view isn't very impressive. There is some sore of "art?" garden outside that could be mistaken for trash.

All and all, you can get a good cup of coffee for you and a friend. It's not really the place for groups. If you are in NODA and need a caffeine fix, Smelly Cat is the place.

Great , friendly atmosphere. They brewed a pour over I requested , excellent! 

Best coffee I've had in Chatlotte. They roast the coffee in the shop.

The coffee is great as usual, but now they've added fresh cooked breakfast items! I've tried almost everything and my favorite is their fresh made everything bagels with bacon and egg. And the items are setup to be taken on-the-go.

I visited Smelly Cat Coffee house recently and had a great experience.  I ordered an iced chai latte with almond milk which was creamy and packed plenty of flavor.  Just the right amount of spices.  As noted by another yelper, the crushed ice was a welcomed surprise.  The coffee shop is cute with indoor and outdoor seating.  The baristas are friendly and free parking is always a plus!
Good coffee in CLT happy with my plain iced americano. Neat scene to sit down and catch up with friends. Quaint small coffee joint.
Can't talk shit about smelly cat. It's perfect place to get coffee and imagine that you aren't in Charlotte anymore.

When I walked into the Smelly Cat, I thought I had finally found a nice coffeehouse in Charlotte (visiting from Seattle for a week).  I liked the funky decor, the brick walls are covered with old doors and other interesting nick knacks, and they use more old doors to separate some of the tables into booths, with electrical outlets.  Outside it was sunny and there are nice little tables to sit at.

The first sign of trouble though, was when I asked for a "cappuccino for here", and was told they only had to go cups, but "they did plan to get real cups sometime this year", if I wanted paper cups, I would have gone to Starbucks.

The second sign was when I picked up the cappuccino and felt it's weight, there was clearly very little foam, and obviously was more of a latte, again I could have just gone to Starbucks and got one of their "wet" cappuccino's.

The final straw though was when I tasted it, it had hints of that taste you get in coffee from a run down truck stop.  I am not sure if they don't clean their machine or what, but it actually made me crave the corporate coffee.

I recommend that anyone visiting Charlotte to try Fabo in Selwyn Corner instead, it at least tastes a little better than the corporate stuff.

I love how customer service oriented this place is. I went in last thursday and they were having a wine tasting later in the evening. I ended up recieving a complimentory truffle to account holders. It was a sweet gesture and the truffle was really pleasent. 

Their flavor of the day roast that they have been doing ::Pumpkin Spice:: is absolutely a hit with me. The flavors dont taste at all artificial and it is so season appropiate. I love their Kona and Guatamalan blends they occasionally have. 

Great Coffee shop, wonderful place to chat the day away.

Super cute coffee house. The reviews don't lie-the dirty chai is perfect. Coffee bean burlap bags cover the ceiling under exposed beams, while the walls are lined with "booths" made with recycled wooden doors. The drink menu is small, but covers the essentials. The atmosphere was quiet (Friday late morning) with people studying intently and Bob Marley playing intermittently between bouts of silence. I was disappointed with the food selection. The items are pre-made, wrapped in foil and kept in a glass case display warmer, reminding me of late night drunken 7-11 visits in my early 20s. There were maybe 3 different types of pastries in a similar (empty) case. I had the southwest burrito which was lukewarm, but tasted good and did the job, but I won't order it again. I will, however come back for that dirty chai!

I only went twice, but the breakfast sandwich was great and filling and the latte was perfect. My biggest problem with Starbucks has always been that they burn their espresso beans and it just doesn't take good; Smelly Cat has such a perfect latte, I never add anything to it.

Also, cool atmosphere and a great place to go for my first time in Charlotte. Thanks so much.

Nice coffee, quaint atmosphere, and reasonably priced. However, I'm afraid most of the staff may drop dead at any moment because they're all dangerously skinny. If those guys aren't vegan then they need to see a doctor. If they are vegan, then they need to stop. If vegetarians laugh at your diet then you probably shouldn't do it. 

Oh, try their milkshake, it'll change your life.

By far the best customer service I've ever had..hands down.  My husband and I went here for the first time today after I had heard some great things about this coffee shop.  I ordered the iced dirty chai latte which they are known for.  I personally wasn't a fan of it..there was some sort of spice in there that didn't agree with me.  I want to note that many many people LOVE this drink so I encourage you to still try it even though I didn't care for it.  I don't believe it was anything they did wrong it just was not my personal favorite.  I was a little nervous to ask for my money back but figured I'd at least ask since I knew I wasn't going to be able to drink it.  Cathy (the owner) was extremely nice.  She asked if they could remake it for me or if I wanted to try something else on top of her giving my money back for the drink..I told her that was okay (I already felt bad for returning the drink!). Then on top of that she encouraged me to come back and try something else and the drink would be on the house.  I've never received such great customer service and encourage anyone to give this place a try.  The next time I'm in the area I will try a different drink.  They also roast their own coffee and offer almond and soy milk which I appreciate since dairy milk does not agree with my stomach.  Terrific owner!

Funky little spot in which we found by luck. I had the caramel frap and I must say it hit the spot. The girl at the counter said they made their syrups and caramel, I indeed could taste the "home made" in it. The caramel was sweet and even a tad-bit salty which made it even better. 
Finding a parking space was no problem, which is always a bonus. It being a Saturday night they were having a group of people doing spoke word session, which made us have a good laugh and added more personality to this coffee shop. 
Got 3 coffees, and 4 pastries for less than $30 and had a great time. 
Will be back soon for more caramel fraps!

One of my favorite places in Charlotte. The atmosphere is fantastic, the coffee is always good and you just never know who you're going to run into. ALL the staff is accommodating, helpful and friendly. If you've not been, you are missing out on one of the Queen City's best kept secrets!

I used to love Smelly Cat because their coffee was excellent and their baristas were really awesome and knew all sorts of things about coffee that I couldn't even begin to understand yet still found fascinating (possibly due to excessive caffeine levels making everything super exciting).  

Their coffee is still good and their baristas are still wonderful, but lately, they have been enforcing more and more policies about their bathroom and parking situations that just make them seem less welcoming.  Having to go back out into the rain to put my signed time-stamped receipt on my dashboard so that I'm allowed to keep my car there for two hours is not okay.  I understand the bathroom code because according to one of their baristas, some not-okay activities were happening in there, and I even understand having to ask for the wi-fi, but it's borderline rude to make customers feel like they have to validate their presence in your establishment.  Sure, parking is tight but it's NoDa and parking is an issue everywhere-that's the nature of the beast.  

Anyways, they have good coffee, but I'm a little disappointed in their new customer policies.  It's less annoying to just go to Amalie's and put up with the ridiculous weekend crowds.

Smelly cat stinks. The espresso was horrible and borderline undrinkable. However I did hold out hope for the bag of beans I purchased. There was no information on the bag regarding roast level and region / location of the beans. As soon as I opened the bag I realized I shouldn't of purchased. The beans were burnt or to be generous a very dark roast. If you are passing through like I was skip this place and go to ANY other coffee shop.

By far my favorite coffee shop in Charlotte! The service is typically always quick, the coffee is amazing and they'll actually take the time to explain a drink to you if you're not sure. Their pastries and breakfast sandwiches are delicious and I haven't even mentioned the coffee yet! Roasted in house this is by far some of the freshest you will find in the area, do yourself a favor and pick a bag up to take home!
Great coffee. Lovely ambiance. Great place to catch up with friends or take a few moments out of your day to unwind. Also, the artwork changes out, so you get to scope out lots of artists.

I visited this coffee house on two occasions during my last visit to Charlotte.  Conveniently placed in the commercial area of NoDa, this place features coffee roasted in-house. We didn't see much in the way of food beyond a few pastries, but I think the coffee makes up for that. I had a café au lait, with the dark roast (which I highly recommend). The flavor was robust and fresh, and the milk was scalded and not overly frothed in the cup, which is what one should expect with that order. My partner had a hazelnut latte, which he described as having light, airy foam that he felt was like sipping into a cloud.

The atmosphere was friendly and artsy. We had the choice of sitting inside or outside, and frankly, we did both.  The inside has outlets at every table for customers bringing laptops, and there are a few benches and tables outside as well.

We will definitely return when we come back to Charlotte to see this place develop!

I live in the neighborhood, and it's a great place ... my favorite cafe in NoDa or Plaza/Milwood! The ambience is really wonderful, as is the service. And, unlike certain places I won't name, they play great (but not overly intrusive) music! A big shout-out to Kyle, who just made some extra effort to brew a special iced-tea I wanted to check out, and a shout-out to all the other baristas. They're friendly and genuinely cool (that is, without the annoying "i'm too hip to do to much work or make chit-chat" attitude you sometimes encounter elsewhere).

Blackberry Frappe is my favorite but I tried their Cortadito Cubano today and it definitely gets my Hispanic stamp of approval!  I have no reservations about this shop. Great staff, helpful coffee tips for us noobs, great music, and a warm vibe that inspires creativity.

I love a cozy, funky coffee shop, and this is one. The kind of place you just want to hang out in all afternoon. Even though I don't live in Charlotte, it felt like a friend was going to just come walking up to chat.

The pumpkin cake was yummy with all the cream cheese, perfect with afternoon coffee.

Given the only thing I've gotten here is various types of ice creams, this place is amazing. The service rocks and the prices are reasonable, while the atmosphere screams cozy coffeehouse. The T-shirts are pretty cool too, I love nothing more than to stop by here and get a desert after I get dinner at Boudreaux down the street :) Very nice and cozy.

Good location in NoDa, the only coffee shop in CLT to offer on-site roasting- big thumbs up!

The coffee is very good, a little inconsistent- sometimes grounds in the bottom of the espresso, sometimes slightly bitter- but no big deal. The staff are quite friendly but aren't as open as other coffee shops, don't tell you about their coffee- but again, no big deal!  

The vibe is very welcoming and enjoyable, a good stop for some good coffee.

With a name like Smelly Cat, I have to admit I wasn't really sure if it'd be that good, but I decided to give it a try for the sake of Friends. It's a cute little place with a sweet outdoor area and decorated with its namesake animal, cats (but not smelly). I love the fact that they roast their own coffee and that there was a coffee roaster in the shop itself.

I decided to try a Vietnamese cold brew coffee out of curiosity since I've never seen that offered anywhere else, and it was delicious and served over crushed ice. My bf got a medium roast coffee and said it was pretty good too. 

Friendly barista, cute coffee shop, delicious coffee with CRUSHED ICE--all reasons why I will make a point to come back here whenever I'm in Charlotte next.

First off, I hate coffee and always have. Let's just get that on the table.

When my friends wanted to stop here for some coffee, I figured I'd just sit with a bottle of water and wait for them to finish. But then I noticed that hot cocoa was on the menu. As it was December and in the 40s, it seemed like a nice fit.

HOLY CRAP. There were chunks of real chocolate in there, AND I was asked if I wanted peppermint in it. Seriously? All this time I thought I was the only weirdo putting peppermint in hot cocoa. No one's ever OFFERED it before! It's like the mother ship was calling me home.

This heavenly concoction was thick and full of flavor. I know no one's ever made a claim to fame by having the best hot chocolate, but this place totally could.

The environment is quaint as well. It's quite eclectic, with several nooks and tables for you to settle into with a good book. 90s music tends to play frequently, and the staff is very nice.

A year later the same group of us found ourselves in Charlotte again, and I refused to leave without stopping at Smelly Cat for the best hot cocoa in the universe.

Love this place so so much!

From their pastries, to their hot chocolate & coffees!

The ambiance is also something unique and amazing. I love quirky little coffee houses, an my only wish was that it was closer to me!

The service is always great & the coffee comes out quick without the taste being compromised.

Definitely a place I'll drive almost 30 min to, just for the coffee. Yum!
Absolutely perfect. Free wifi great coffee and great atmosphere.
Just got tea but it was awesome! Love the vibes and friendliness of the staff. Kind of lost walking in but they were very patient and helped walk me through their offerings.

Coffee not at a chain is hard to find in charlotte. I love buying local and on my days off. I am more than willing to drive the extra ten minutes to get it. The coffee is the best I've found in town and the service is equally great.

I was passing through Charlotte again and decided to pay another visit to the Cat.  My first review (which I would urge you to read for the humor alone) documented Lattegate.  They have pretty baristas here - today the beauty of the barista split me down the middle like a battleaxe.  Yes, I just compared being struck by beauty to being split with a battleaxe.  I wonder if that is "awesome" or not.  Some choose Cupid - I apparently choose Viking imagery.

Anyway, this time I ordered your regular ol' coffee and realized that the beans are from Dilworth.  Dilworth is a place that I absolutely savaged in a Yelp review because I felt that it wasn't what it was advertised to be, but you'll note that I never had a problem with the beans, which is an arena where Dilworth truly does a good job.  I'm glad that Smelly Cat is sourcing beans from a local, high quality roaster.  

The cup was great; I then realized that there was a wine rack on the wall.  Malbec, what what?  Yes please.  I must have missed this aspect of Smelly Cat before.  They had a malbec from Argentina that was very tasty.  This is one of the grape varietals used in production of Bordeaux within France and is popularly grown in Argentina - I am digging malbec these days.

I followed up my coffee and wine by bashfully approaching the barista to ask about the wifi.  It's a password-protected wifi system.

In the end, Smelly Cat is my home base in Charlotte as far as coffee is concerned.  As long as life keeps dragging me through Charlotte I'll be stopping by.

I visited here once and really like the coffee here. However, I have gone back two other times and left without getting coffee because I could not find a parking space. That is a huge headache that will prevent me from going back. Coffee is good but not that good for me to circle the establishment for ten minutes looking for parking.

Good local coffee shop where they roast their coffee. My fave is New Orleans cold brew with cream.. Had a good time "hangout" with the owner during Charlotte Coffee Crawl event.. Definitely a coffee shop you need to stop when you're in the area.

My first time to Smelly Cat was just the other day. I had heard lots of great things about this little coffee shop for quite some time and though i'd better check it out. Well I definitely was not disappointed! This is a real, authentic coffee shop with a great vibe and funky decorating. The woman at the counter kindly helped me decide on a soy dirty chai, something i've never had before but I put my trust in her! It was one of the greatest drinks i've ever had....the chai here is amazing, you must try it! Smelly Cat is a great place to study or just hang out, the staff are cool and friendly, and the coffee is beyond amazing. 
Stop going to chains and try this place!

My first Charlotte coffee shop visited. Love the vibe--inside and out. Always clean and friendly! Barista was excited to share cold brew samples with me. Tasty coffee. Nice seating. Good music choices. Adequate internet. I have enjoyed studying here. Great location. Parking can be hard, but with a little walk, it's not a problem.

Went there twice while in town for the Belk Bowl.  My wife and I are hooked and secretly hoping the team goes to the same bowl again so we can have some awesome coffee and hot chocolate.  Definitely a MUST VISIT if you're in town.

I've been digging on Smelly Cat for about a decade now. It's a fun little spot and it's nice to see how they've grown and changed over the years. I love that they now offer "real food" that they make in house, meaning I can get breakfast, lunch, and light supper items there in addition to their pastries. One big difference compared to some mom and pop coffee places in the city is that they make their own syrups. I'm IN LOVE with the coconut syrup! The only challenges I've ever had are finding a (good) table [it's very small and popular location so space is at a premium, especially if it's too cold or hot to sit outside] and parking. 

In Summary:
+ Fantastic Coffee!!!
+ Friendly staff/Good Service
+ Okay pastry/ Good Veggie Chili!
+ Vegan/Vegetarian Friendly
+ Quaint eclectic atmosphere (although very small)
- Parking challenges

First time going to this coffee house. I've heard so much about this place so I thought I give it a try. It was amazing! I had the Dirty Chai with soy. Very good and very nice people. I will be going back for sure.

Any time I get coffee anywhere else (*cough*starbucks*cough*), I regret not going to Smelly Cat. They make great espresso drinks, amazing hot chocolate and brew great coffee. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is really chill. A great place to sit and do some work or hang out with friends.

I typically enter into a coffee shop with the hope of getting a delicious cup of coffee or espresso. I arrived at the Smelly Cat with this expectation and was severely disappointed. The coffee was very bland and my friend who ordered espresso was also disappointed in her order. It is definitely a cool place to hang out, despite our lack of proper caffeine buzz we played Scrabble for at least two hours. There are board games to be played and it would be an excellent place to study with some goodies on-hand to nosh on. I would not recommend Smelly Cat for a delicious or satisfying cup a joe.

This is one of my favorite spots in all of Charlotte. The coffee is great (especially since they started roasting themselves), and the staff is fun. They're also great with recommendations. Every now and then I just want to try something totally new, and everything they've recommended has been delicious.

The cuban coffee is a must, but they make the best soy dirty chai over ice that I have EVER had.
This is the coolest little coffee shop I've found, they always have cool art and they have a great menu and coffees, love it here.
A nice place to sit outside and people watch. Had the dirty chai and would return again for that. The chai was a nice blend not candy sweet.

I was hanging out in NODA a couple of times listening to music, drum circles and heard this one man band inside smelly cat. Of course if you have watched Friends, you know Fibi and her song. So this man had his knees strapped with symbols, hands on his guitar, Mic with a harmonica, and feet tapping on the drums below. He could sing too. Coffee was great. Many flavors, I think there were scones. Cozy walk up place. Noda is all park and walk around.

Excellent independent coffee shop.  Hometown feel with NoDa culture.  Staff is friendly and the locals are interesting.  Good place to relax or have laid back business meeting.  Free Wifi and rocking chairs don't hurt either.

Best coffee in the Queen City, hands down. I love coming here early in the morning, never once will you meet a rude barista in this coffee house. The staff are always so friendly and perky. Watching them roast the beans in front of you is always a treat.

The barista was very nice. The space is really cute. The tea latte I ended up with was tasty. And the price for it was very modest.

However, they were out of decaf espresso, so they couldn't make decaf coffee drinks. And despite the reviews talking about gluten-free treats, they didn't have any. So I was a bit disappointed.

Wonderful local coffee shop!  The fact that amazing cold brew coffee is just a couple of blocks away from my house is like a dream come true.  Friendly staff, they roast their own beans, my wife loves the lattes, and there are some nice seating options (though they are few).  Highly recommend Smelly Cat if you want a great cup of coffee, latte, or cold brew!
Good cafe.  Great area and vibe.  Too bad they sold out of my size of t-shirt.  Oh yeah, the coffee was excellent.  Had the sweeten sled New Orleans iced and it was superb.

Smelly Cat Coffee is a cool little spot in one of Charlotte's "hip" spots called NODA. The interior of the place is equally as "hip". I've actually seen people hanging out here with their cats on a leash which I thought was pretty fitting. I would love to hang out here with my laptop and do some work but there is one thing that RUINS this place for me... 

The coffee is terrible!

I am a bit of a coffee snob so take my review with a grain of salt. I don't drink lattes or frozen drink I like a plain cup of black coffee. I've been here twice and both times it was impossible to finish my cup of coffee because I was so bad. It's so bitter and acidic! I have yet to try a good cup of coffee here. It's comparable to gas station coffee, just a step above.

So go hang out here but don't get a cup of coffee.

My favorite coffee shop in Charlotte. Artsy feel, friendly baristas, and a great place to relax, have a conversation, or study. So good. My personal favorites are: Mocha Frappe, Caramel Apple Cider, Toasted Coconut Frappe, and the various teas Smelly Cat offers.

This has to be my favorite coffee house in Charlotte.  The atmosphere is eclectic and inviting.  The place has a lot of older type couches and chairs which also make it unique.  As far as the coffee itself goes, it is always strong and fresh.  I have had espresso drinks and just regular brewed coffee and all of the drinks have been made perfectly.  I wish I lived a little closer, as I would visit more often.  If you want a coffee shop that is off the beaten path, give this place a try.

Great place to work or study. Good coffee, tea, and beer selection. 

Can get a little crowded at times, but clears out quickly.

Accessible parking in their lot. If parking lot is full, you can find parking on the street easily.

So cute. I was in town with my boyfriend for the weekend and ended up in the NODA area for some food. We decided to walk around a little afterwards to look for some coffee and found this gem. It is a little standalone building with a creative logo that you can't miss! I would definitely see myself here often if I lived in the area. There is seating indoor and outdoor so it is a great little place to get some work done, enjoy some time to yourself, or have a chat with some friends while drinking some good coffee.
Definitely the best coffee house we've been to so far in NC!  The owner is personable, the coffee fresh roasted and delicious, and the ambience very relaxing. We will be back - probably frequently!
Tried the sweet New Orleans cold brew, southwest burrito and choice cheddar scone. All were delicious!

Perfect fit for Noda neighborhood of Charlotte... don't take the "Cat" for granted; our little 'hood wouldn't be the same without her!  Great coffee, great baristas all right here within walking distance of all our other great Noda spots!

A representative from this restaurant responded to my review both publicly and via message telling me that their employee offered me items that they did not and that I received "on point" service and that my review was unwarranted. Their employee lied to them. We were not offered any such items. I wish we had been as they do sound delicious and would have likely saved our experience. We looked at the menu offerings, ordered several items to which she only repeatedly responded "so sorry we are out of that." Smelly Cat's combative and "customer is wrong" response to my review only furthers my negative opinion of this restaurant and it's staff. I am simply a visitor from out of town looking for a good breakfast experience who was sorely disappointed. I have no reason to lie, but the employee does. The restaurant management would be better served addressing their employee performance and dishonesty rather than acting like they were there when they were not and treating disappointed customers with hostility.
Cool vibe, artsy neighborhood, good coffee. They offer 3 daily brews, including one flavored brew. The iced coffee is tasty, as well.

Oh Smelly Cat, can I come live in your space? I can bake the gluten free treats you offer along with your other pastries, stock your cooler with Odwalla and blynk organic products that you provide, clean for you plus treat you really well. I would make sledge hammers within a minute, give spectacular service and make sure your paintings done by local artists would sell. I would make sure all the little pods you have are spotless and that the Wi Fi was working so free wireless for everyone! I can give you the love you really need Smelly Cat, the love you deserve. You have been so good to me in the past with the aromas of various brewed coffees, reasonable prices and kitschy design, I feel like it's the least I could do for you. 

Let's turn this dream into a reality. Love, 

Tiffany

Smelly Cat,  Smell-y cat...it's not your fault that you will like this place.  Breakfast items are very good and the coffee hits the spot.  

The one-off menu items that I have tried are also very good.  The pumpkin/banana bread is a nice complement to the coffee.

Worth the drive and dealing with the wanna-be hipsters on the way there.

I thoroughly enjoyed my afternoon at Smelly Cat.  They've got all of the markings of the hip coffee shop experience: local artists' work as well as other types of quirky flair on the walls, little multicolored tables and chairs, just-off-mainstream but still pleasant music, thoughtfully planned nook/booth seating so you can sip your drink and work in your own private little world.  On the other hand, they also actually had friendly and helpful service, a welcome break to some previous hipster coffee shop experiences I've had in the past. I had a wonderfully refreshing iced tea and a slice of rich cheesecake, and I noticed that they also offer ice cream, all variety of espresso drinks and vegan treats (if you're into that kind of thing).  I do see how coming by at the wrong time could be a problem, what with the somewhat limited seating options, but I guess that's the price one pays for cozy.

I stopped by this coffee house to get some work done. They were unable to make pour overs at the time of my visit, so I ordered a cafe au lait. The coffee was ok, the setting was cute, and they blasted 80's music the entire time I was there. I liked that this place has plenty of parking spaces, free wifi, and plenty of tables/chairs to get work done indoors or outdoors!

I've posted up at Smelly Cat a few times now for weekend work sessions and I've really enjoyed it. Their coffee is better than most that I've had in the city and their pastries are quite good as well. I've only ever been on the weekends but they get quite a bit of foot traffic here. 

The baristas are very nice. It's a relatively standard set up with about 8 tables (three fun little alcoves) and one bar where sometimes people can sit and sometimes they have baristas using the Chemex. It can get crowded when everyone is standing around waiting for their drinks to be ready, but they work quickly. There is also some outdoor seating which is lovely, either on the sidewalk or the side of the building facing the parking lot. They always have music playing and I personally think they have good taste. My only complaint is the tables are a bit small (though admittedly, my laptop is enormous) and the AC is always WAY too high. 

I will keep going back because I dig the ambience and the coffee ain't too shabby.

Great area (NoDa). I'm a full time student, and this is an incredible place for me to come, kick back, and study for a little while. The coffee is delicious, though a bit overprices compared to some of the competition in the area.

Definitely recommend if you are wanting to try something new and unique.

I didn't have coffee but my wife got a cup, cool little place and quick service. The staff really knows there coffee right down to the flavor notes the different beans are giving off. She always gets coffee from there when we are in NODA during the day. I really like how they roast their own beans. Next time we are in NODA, Ill have to get a coffee as well.
A cute little spot hidden in NoDa. Love meeting friends here for coffee or just catching up on some laptop work here.

Cool location and the best cup of coffee on our trip. Cool shirt and mug bought there too, but a bit pricey for the swag though.

Gal ringing us up was very apathetic, but that was her and didn't affect the product one bit. 

Would definitely come back if passing through again.

As much as I enjoy the always popular Starbucks and the lesser known Caribou Coffee, Smelly Cat is a wonderful change of pace.  The decor is awesome, the service is fantastic and, most importantly, the coffee is outstanding!!

Best Parts
1. High quality coffee
2. Best biscuits in town
3. Nice ambience inside and many chairs to use outside the shop. Cool place to hang out for coffee date or chat with friends 
4. Convenient varieties of coffee and chai

Bad parts
1. Minimal parking spots
2. Only bottle beers available

I've been coming here for years, I buy bags of beans, frappes, smoothies! Always delicious and always a pleasant experience! Nice cozy atmosphere with good tunes to listen to, bring your laptop or tab!! Toasted coconut frappe is my fave ;)
had an instance or two where the beans were too dry, but still a very good brew

I wish I liked this place better than I do. Coffee is just ok and it always takes forever to get my coffee, no matter how busy or not busy it us. There always seems to be a conversation going on with the barista and a local that distracts from my service. That said; the place is cute with only a few tables and a small outdoor area. But I guess if you live in NoDa and you need your coffee fix and Amelie's is not an option...here you go.
Great Dirty Chi and funky atmosphere. The Hubbs and I drive from 25 min away just to get a coffee and hang out. Worth a little drive.

Lacking. This was not the worst cup I've ever had, but the place left a lot to be desired.  I opted for their Ethiopian off a V60 , and when I prodded the girl at the counter for a little more info about it, i.e. where was it grown, she looked at me crooked and said "Ethiopia". Inspiring.  Another woman behind the counter who sort of looked like she could have been the owner said that was a valid question, but didn't know the answer and didn't bother to find out. The technique on the pour itself was poor. Splashing water over grounds does not make good coffee... Especially when half the water is poured straight down the filter. These folks need proper training. The cup itself was marginal. Under extracted likely due to bad technique, and the characteristics of the cup were such that, to me, suggested the roast had gone too long in the drum, slightly carmalized and somewhat scorched.  Lacking the bright acidity that draws me to beans from this origin.  Considering the near non existent coffee culture I guess there's not a ton of motivation for a shop to shine when they can squeak by on a convenient location, but really, if you're going to do something, do it well.

Bar none, this is my favorite Coffee house in the Charlotte metro area. They capture the neighborhood feel of NoDa perfectly. Having recently moved out of the area the one thing that I miss THE most are my daily trips to Smelly Cat.

I have been coming here for many years and I have to say that the group of people that work here are amazing. Forgive me if I misspell  anyone's name....Tony seems to have the roasting business mastered as he roasts all of their beans in house. Not only do I go for a cup daily but I also buy all of my beans for home from here. Tony really influenced my love for this place as he immediately learned my name , my favorite type of roast and it felt to me like each time I stepped in the door that I received amazing service from him. This stretches throughout all of the staff ( the Rachels are the same, super attentive , wonderfully kind and they go out of their way to make my visits great). On top of this the owner is a frequent face within Smelly Cat and within the local NoDa community. She is as pleasant as anyone I have met and I can tell that she has put her stamp on the culture of this business. I sometimes wonder how they are able to keep such a quality staff of people as you don't find this within many businesses, it clearly stands out! 

I will be ordering all of my beans on line from now on and I have already figured out a away to steer my workday through NoDa a couple times a week just so I can still enjoy my favorite spot. The atmosphere is great, the staff are great and the coffee is great...thanks Smelly Cat crew!!!

-Cameron

Fun little coffee shop. I was drawn to it by the name, and enjoyed my drinks at it. The parking is not fun around this area. I went during a not so busy time during the day, so there was room to sit inside and enjoy my drink. I have tried to go back since and have had no luck parking. Drinks were good and very well made. Bought my friend some coffee beans to make coffee at home, and they really enjoyed it.

wow this is exactly as a cafe should be. in fact if I ever were to open a cafe, and I often have dreamt of it, this is exactly what i would have done.

charming decor, local artists on display, great music, free wifi, cozy tables, awesome staff, loose leaf tea, cool mugs, and a nice crowd.

love it!

This is definitely the 'homey-est' vibe of any coffee shop in Charlotte.  (Well, that and Mug's.  But, Smelly Cat is like studio apartment in NoDa homey.  Mug's is kind of like your Grandma's living room homey)

SC is warm, eclectic, and the music they play is dope.  Coffee is solid, too.

I dig it and go here often.

I am a coffee connoisseur I drink nothing but lattes from different coffee houses Starbucks is one of my main ones Cafe Con Leche Cuban style it's another great one but when I had my first one from Smelly Cat Coffee OMG world's best world's best best latte around

I walked in here after strolling around Noda waiting for lunch time at Cabo Fish Taco. With no line, I decided to order an iced chai - medium. Normally I get 2% milk, but I wasn't sure if they carried, whole, skim, etc. so I asked. They have several different kinds, but what I settled on was Almond milk. It was my first time trying out this combo, and it was delicious! Definitely hit the spot on a warm day, and is now my new favorite drink. Better yet, it was less than $5.

This is a pretty weak excuse for a coffee shop. Even the name of the place is an embarrassment if you ask me. I suppose that they are fans of the show Friends? Menu is unoriginal and over price. The place is a weak imitation of Starbucks; and a rude staff as well! Do not waste your time or money at Smelly Cat.

Such a cute coffee shop by our Airbnb in Charlotte! Stopped in here on our way out of town and wishing I would have found it sooner. The staff was really friendly and the coffee was tasty. I also had a breakfast sandwich that didn't disappoint!

Cold brew coffee: 5/5

Chai Latte: 7/5

Zucchini bread: 5/5

This little place is dynamite! Definitely not your average Starbucks wannabe coffee shop. This place has an awesome vibe, a wide variety of pastries, muffins & treats baked in-house. Awesome products, and good prices!

Don't let the name fool you, they have great coffee all around.  And they have soy milk for non-dairy people.  Very cozy atmosphere.  Cool booths made out of antique doors.  A down home kitchen feel but equally appropriate for coffee snobs who would like to go somewhere besides Starbucks for a change.  Not that I have anything against Starbucks, but I'm looking forward to visiting Smelly Cat again.

What a great, local coffee shop! 

Located in the NoDa district, it boasts subtle charm, friendly baristas, and worthwhile coffee. In a sea of Counter Culture coffee shops (which are not unappreciated, ftr), I applaud their independence earned by roasting their own beans in-house (on a 25lb Probat, no less). 

Their music selection is current and trendy, appealing to most 20-somethings. They offer both manual pourovers, ready-brewed air pot coffee, along with full espresso and tea service. The free (passworded) wifi is also a plus. 

If I had one qualm, it's that they serve flavored coffee offerings. Since they prepare all their offerings in-house, the lingering aroma is a little overwhelming. But coffee aficionados: don't let this dissuade you from stopping! They do a fantastic job with their roasts.

I wish Columbia had a place like this! 

I've been to Smelly Cat (what a name!) twice and both times have loved it. I think last night it really took my breath away. 

The reason I'm giving this place five is more for atmosphere than quality of food/drink. To be honest, I've only had a coffee, a tea, and a red velvet cupcake at the coffeehouse so I can't say I've sampled that much. From what I've ordered though, I've been very happy with what I got. As for the service, both times I've been to Smelly Cat, the baristas have been very sweet and professional. 

But to talk about the atmosphere, well, WOW. Especially last night (Friday). I don't know if it's like this all the time, but the place was oozing community and felt so good to be a part of it. When we got there it was around 9pm and we wanted to get coffee and dessert and play a game of scrabble. There were a couple of tables outside and a few wicker benches to choose from. One table was occupied with a group of friends and their very loving and playful dog. Another table had a musician playing the xylophone. At one of the wicker benches, there was a small group playing the guitar. We snagged an empty four top and proceeded w/our scrabble game. Several pedestrians with dogs and children walked by. As the night progressed, a drum circle formed around the xylophone player and they created magical music. Many people who walked by stopped to dance and interact with the musicians. Inside the cafe as more people came in, there were others like us who cracked open board games and drank their coffee and chatted away.  I hate to sound new age, but the energy was astounding, and it was really cool to get to share some of it.

Also NoDa is a beautiful area, so the combination of the neighborhood feel, warm almost summer breeze, the music, and the smell of good coffee, was just priceless.
Great hot chocolate and cortados. Needs better signage. A little small if you were hoping to sit down and enjoy your drink on a cold day, but there is some seating if you get there early.

Cozy space to hang out. I dropped in for some afternoon coffee before walking around the neighborhood to check out what NoDa has to offer.

I gave their Ethiopian brew a try but I wasn't too impressed. I noticed they have a pour over set up after buying a small coffee. Would have ordered a pour over if I had known!
Good place to eat breakfast and get coffee. I especially like the sausage egg and cheese biscuits. I recommend to anyone to try this place because it's awesome.
Couldn't find a singing Phoebe Buffay, but I did find some friendly folks and coffee sooooo good it'll make you watch Friends re-runs!

I've been wanting to try Smelly Cat for a while now and unfortunately it didn't live up to my expectations.  I'm hoping I just caught this place on a bad night.  It was very slow (only 2 other customers in the place) and there was only one person working.  I ordered my standby, a skinny mocha, and was disappointed.  It barely had any coffee flavor and just didn't taste right for a mocha.  I also tried out one of the delicious-looking chocolate cupcakes which turned out to be just ok.  I'm starting to wonder if cupcakes just aren't my thing.

The part of the visit that makes me want to come back is the cozy and quirky atmosphere.  The decor is really cool with old rustic doors that section off seating areas and plenty of local artwork on the walls.  Although most of the tables I saw during my visit were dirty I have a feeling it isn't always this way.  I want to come back with my laptop or kindle, grab a cup of coffee and stay for a while to see if this place grows on me.
Very good tea, nice atmosphere and very friendly staff. Even working on a Holiday, everyone was enthusiastic and nice to customers. Loved the place.

it was ok. I had to wait 20 minutes for my coffee because it was so busy and they only had 2 people working & then they gave my sisters coffee to somebody else so we had to wait another 5 minutes. It took way longer than it should have. The coffee however was very good. I got the chunky monkey frappe & it was amazing. The costumer service on the other hand was bad as the lady who worked there was rude to everyone.

This seems to be "The Coffee shop" in Charlotte based on reviews so I had to give it a try. 

I will say that space is limited inside, but there is also outdoor seating. I personally do not like sitting outside if the weather isn't just right. But that's just me.

I ordered a dirty chai and an egg and cheese biscuit. I found a comfy space and tucked myself into a corner. Both the latte and biscuit were delish.

I would come back here to write. I liked the vibe and the people were very nice.

Stumbled upon Smelly Cat Coffee with some friends while we were in Charlotte for the weekend and looking for a caffeine fix on a Sunday afternoon. The name, of course, instantly brings to mind Phoebe from Friends. I ordered a frappe because the weather was nice and I wasn't disappointed. Actually, the only disappointment was that they were out of whipped cream (!). Whoopsies.

Naturally when I even think of Smelly Cat, I want to sing the Phoebe Buffay song from 'Friends'..."smelly cat, oh smelly cat, what are they feeding you?" HA, just like you Nicole (I just read your review)! :D
Smelly Cat is always busy...which is a good thing! I've walked here many a time (from further down N Davidson St). Love that they have indoor & outdoor seating; however, on a nice day, you'll see everyone wants to be out on the patio. No Da is the perfect place for this coffeehouse.
I go with the Hazelnut coffee each time & it's yummy!

Funky little joint that quickly went on my itinerary based on the name alone!
Sweet New Orleans was the iced coffee I got in the store as well as as a bag of NoDA espresso and their dark blend. Haven't broken into those bad boys yet but the place was nice and clean. There weren't any room in the parking lot so I had to park a little in the sidewalks.

I'm a avid coffee drinker and the coffee quality and taste is very important. My lady told me about this place called Noda and Smell Cat popped up. With a list of great reviews I had too try it out. Starbucks can only thrill a coffee lover so much till we need a new unique taste. This place has a amazing ambience and atmosphere. You'll notice private tables and their coffee roaster right in the middle of the store. I've tried two of their blends, Black Cat being my favorite. I took a bag of LLorana home which was a little darker. Very good roasted coffee. I highly recommend. Only problem, too far from my house.
Iced white coconut mocha. Yum! Hubby had blended spiced brown sugar caramel latte.  Delicious.  I'll come every time I'm in Charlotte!!

Do you remember Phoebe's song- smelly cat? :)
Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat,
What are they feeding you?
Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat,
It's not your fault

Well this coffee house in Charlotte has no connection to it. :)
Smelly Cat Coffeehouse Roaster is an award-winning local coffeehouse and Coffee Roaster. It's located in the NoDa neighborhood in Charlotte and is very charming and quirky. The coffee house has seating in the front, side of building and inside. The inside is decorated in this rustic farmhouse vibe and is a very cozy space. They have a few nooks inside for seating two. 

The barista that served my friend and I was very pleasant and patient with us. It was our first visit so it took us a moment to decide on our drink of choice  for the hot and humid Sunday afternoon. 

I ended up ordering an ice latte with toasted coconut syrup and almond milk. I took a sip and thought, man oh man, this is a good cup of coffee. The coffee had a smooth and bright flavor, no bitter taste. This would definitely be my go to coffee shop if I lived here. Great coffee, funky atmosphere and good service - love it!

My conscience is forcing me to review this place. Selfishly, I'd like to keep this little Noda treasure all to myself.  Cannot say enough about Smelly Cat Coffee shop. Superior, friendly staff...excellent coffee and delish pastries. And probably the coolest place to hang out in Charlotte. Super friendly patrons...lots and lots of dog lovers to chat with. And really great outdoor spaces in front and on each side. My one regret: that they're not closer to my place in South Charlotte.

Smelly Cat is a quaint little spot if you're in the noda area and are in the mood for some good coffee. I do with that they had more seating area since its often crowded during gallery crawls but otherwise its a great spot to chill with your friends and enjoy the noda vibe.

Smelly Cat smells quite delicious-wifts of freshly roasted coffee.  Another flattering review of Smelly Cat seems redundant, but here's my observations about this place

-High "perk" factor of baristas-I can't even pull off that level of perkiness with liberal doses of caffeine

-Variety of bevies- Chai lattes, a different flavor of iced tea daily on special, several roast of coffee to choose from.  They keep iced coffee (don't know if its cold press) but it does the trick.  

-Dilworth coffee used in coffee beverage-It's "dil-worthy" of praise, wha wha whaaa!

-Smallish-Though I wouldn't likely loiter here for hours, I would certainly visit Smelly Cat on a lunch break or before a big day in NoDa (or night, if you know what I mean).

The overall experience is great.  I like light or medium roast coffee and I find it to be a tad bitter here.  It's really good, but it's not as smooth as I've had in other coffeehouses.  Overall, Smelly Cat makes NoDa what it is.
I always like coming here. Friendly staff, chill environment, good for reading/studying.
A great place to get coffee in NoDa. The staff is always so friendly & they have the best hot chocolate. The set up inside is pretty cute too. There's always a lot of seating outside as well.

This is my go-to spot to work on projects and concentrate outside the house. Good coffee, friendly staff, free wi-fi, and comfortable seating. Parking can be hard to come by if there's an event in the neighborhood - most often on Fri/Sat nights or Sunday mornings. The chocolate chip frappe is my favorite drink.
Smelly Cat is a nice quaint little spot in the NoDa area. The Frappe I had there was absolutely delicious!

ha just like nicole...i sang smelly cat smelly cat the entire ride to the coffee house.  

great selection of drinks, pastries, and super cute atmosphere.  great for hanging out with friends, grabbing a quick drink, or even a business meeting if you want to get away from the chain of starbucks (which i'm not really a fan of)

highly recommend and will definitely return!

Cozy place for drink coffee, work or play some games with friends.
I love their different coffee beans.

Smelly Cat is everything - and then some! 

First off.. the name! Gotta love Phoebe! 

Second.. the neighborhood. Love it.

Third.. the decor. So dark and hipstery. Not usually my vibe but it is done so well, here!

Fourth.. COLD BREW. All the cold brews! Like four of em!

Fifth.. beer.

Sixth.. homemade syrups! That toasted coconut syrup is perfection.. coconutty, toasty, and not cloyingly sweet! 

I'm a fan!
Great little place in Noda. Super cozy and warm. I'm particularly a fan of this place in the fall and winter.
Trendy, but coffee leaves something to be desired. Location is good though and the decor is novel. Okay place, but way overhyped, I don't get it.

What a great find while passing through town! Amazing coffee (they even have Cuban coffee, as well as cold brew on tap) and a super friendly staff. I would love to find more coffee shops like this around the US. 

I will definitely be going back here whenever possible.

Nice little spot in NODA, could smell the fresh coffee from outside. Sat outside with the wife and drank a coconut frappe. Seating was nice and comfortable, inside was cozy. Everyone should visit Smelly Cat Coffee House!

Pretty sure if I lived in Charlotte I would spend a lot of time here.  Just walking through the door made me smile.  

All around friendly staff, yielding friendly patrons, drinking smooth, rich coffee, eating totally passable baked goods and just all-around putting out some positive coffee house energy.  

If you lived here, you'd be home now
Michelle and Allison are the dream team baristas! Best iced white mocha in Charlotte.

Great coffee and I really love the ambience.
I had the cortadito (Cuban coffee with a touch of foamed milk) and silly me I forgot to mix it up a little so the brown sugar ended up at the bottom of the cup! Still yummy, in spite of my operator error.

Although I have been to NoDa several times in the past, today was my first time going to Smelly Cat. I had a great first experience there and definitely recommend stopping by if you're ever in the area! It's cozy, quirky and even has outdoor seating. 

They have awesome service, and everyone there was so friendly. My friend and I met all the workers on a first name basis and even met Cathy, the owner who is such a sweet lady by the way. They made me feel like I was a regular customer!

There were numerous drinks on the menu but not many pastry choices, which is why I did not give it five stars. By suggestion, I ordered an iced dirty chai in the biggest size they had. It usually comes with four shots of espresso, but I asked for one less shot. I thought it was delicious-- and this is coming from someone who is not so fond of the chai-taste!

Visiting Charlotte and stopped here mainly because of the name. Very eclectic. Everyone was nice and friendly. The locals drew you into conversation. Right amount of quiet. We split a Apple cinnamon/cinnamon apple muffin that was moist and delicious. Coffee was great. They make their own with this up machine onsite. Would love to come back and just sit for a while.

I was looking for a coffee and this was the highest reviewed, so I came here. I do not live in Charlotte so I had no clue what to expect. I'm not sure what they did to the blended mocha I got, but it was honestly the best coffee I've ever had. 

After being rejuvenated with a cool, caffeinated drink, I tracked down a Lime Scooter and drove all over North Davidson. Thankfully, I didn't get run over. I parked the scooter in front of Smelly Cat, but I'm sure it has been moved since my visit!
The "kegged" cold brew coffee is delicious! Especially if you like the flavor/texture of a good coffee stout.

More of a meeting place for NoDa than a coffee shop (at least to me). The coffee is standard - but you can tell there is a lot of love for what coffee shops represent. And lets face it, you don't really just want a cup of coffee when you're hanging out at Smelly Cat...you want to feel cool that you're drinking coffee in public with your friends and neighbors.

For a non-coffee drinker, going to a coffee shop seems like a dangerous choice, but Smelly Cat still delivered.

Located in Noda, once again, maintaining a charm unseen in other cities, Smelly Cat was a hipster paradise (and I say that in all the best ways). With a modern flair, and comfy seats, I sat at the window to people watch. 

My breakfast on this particular morning was a vegan bar that was perfect size, with a hot cocoa on an otherwise chilly morning in December. There was nothing wrong with the flavors I enjoyed on this particular day, and if you are a coffee drinker I imagine, based on the hot chocolate, that you will not be disappointed.
Pricey, but so good. I love love love the friends theme and I worked from there last week. It was nice to just be out of the office in a great coffee shop

There was an intermittent alternate dimension happening at Smelly Cat over the past couple of days, and it made for great people watching. Case in point: today several groups of fourth graders paraded in throughout the day to read their own poetry, open-mic style. It was quite the site to see, what with all of the rhyming prose and the enraptured listening of the teaching set, and when it was over? Snaps, just like the beats like it. Ginsberg might have been confused, but he might have been proud.

Smelly Cat Coffee House is just what the name implies, a cozy cove of fluffy chairs, enclaves, and cafe tables that make camping out here in NoDa fun. My meetings today flew by, not the least of which was because of the hazelnut Italian soda I slammed, or the arty ramblings of children, or the giant leafblower that careened about when I sat outside for a bit. It's a little on the small side, but you don't have to be gigantic to be a cool coffee room. And as it turns out, if you're here, the ability to snap effectively helps.

Their coffee is good. However.  Asked for a top off and they wanted to charge me for another full cup. This is bad business. You have a 160z cup as a large size with no option for larger. Many people drink 20 to 24oz. There is no question they are losing potential business with this ill-advised policy. Also. Kind of interesting claiming to be an eclectic coffee shop in the heart of NODA while gouging people at the same time. What irony and hypocrisy

Best americano in Charlotte! The staff is fabulous at this cozy establishment. I had a Mediterranean quiche that was to die for the last time I popped in, and I always just get good all around good vibes here.

Fantasic, cute, coffee place! Amazing frappes and smoothies. Came here with my nephew, brother, sister in law. We each got frappes while my nephew got a smoothie! So tasty and delish! I got the toaste coconut frappe and it literally so was creamy wet and silky smooth! I cant stop thinking about it!

The parking is a complete nightmare mess in the area and there are signs everywhere warning of towing. Smelly cat even suggests putting you recipet on your dash of your car to protect it from towing.

I would be back here in a heart beat! Beat frappe of my life. However, took off a star for the parking. It wasa royal pain and a total frightmare !!!  Be ware !

I was pleasantly surprised by the good cappuccino, nice people and cool ambient of the cafe and the whole neighborhood on an early Sunday morning. Also kids-friendly: great cocoa. The name of the cafe is a mystery for me but if they secretly serve Kopi luwak coffee I wouldn't mind :-)

Smelly Cat Coffee is a cool hip spot in the heart of NoDa!

Great service & environment! I ordered a cortadito and although it wasn't exactly what I'd get back in Miami, it was a good try and tasted great! I also ordered an apple muffin which was the PERFECT morning snack to go along with the espresso. Although I was only there for 20 minutes, the vibe and atmosphere is very welcoming and the perfect spot to read, study, chat and get your morning going. Right in the back of the Cafe, they have a small market on Saturdays which you can check out after you're done. It was definitely a cool spot filled with locals.
This place is everything you want in a coffee shop. Great coffee, great ambiance, great staff - I never want to leave! Try their Vietnamese Iced Coffee!

My neighborhood favorite! Smelly Cat is the bomb! Every time I walk into this NoDa gem a smile instantly crosses my face. From the delicious Almond Milk Chai Latte (yes they have almond milk) to the awesome service of Miss Frankie & Miss Leah, there is never a time where Smelly Cat does make my day.

Thanks for the yummy caffeine and sorry for all the times that Torrie (of #thesavageway) and I rearrange your tables for work! :)

Nice, querky stop along the way. Like others have posted earlier, it definitely is eclectic, artsy, and independent. It has good energy, draws a good crowd. Music adds to the chill atmosphere too.

I guess they are pretty open on allowing pets in because a patron brought her dog in with her. The bathroom was clean...always a plus.

I'll be back!

I can never have another Starbucks chai latte ever again after having one here. Trust me, I've tried.  Bummer since I just got on that train a few weeks ago. 

The Smelly Cat has a short but delicious selection of lattes, frappes, and smoothies. Their chai latte had so much flavor I couldn't handle. I tried to drink a Starbucks chai latte a few days later but it now tastes watered down and lackluster. 

The cafe itself is decorated with a collection of cat novelty items and other random trinkets. There is wifi and cute outside seating available as well.  I will definitely be stopping by again next time I'm in NoDa :)

I came here my first time and Charlotte and got their brown butter latte. I literally could not stop thinking about it and had to come back the next time I visited. Good coffee, fun homemade syurps, and an awesome vibe.

Great coffee, fast service, polite staff. They alway great you genuinely and not with a fake forced smile. 
Great outdoor seating but inside is a little cozy.
I got a spiced brown sugar latte and it was very good! Great service and got my drink super fast! Also the atmosphere is just so beautiful! So much detail everywhere!

I love to support local coffee shops and Smelly Cat makes that really easy.  First, their coffee is great. They have a good selection daily of different brews.  I also like that they offer a daily flavored brew as well.  If your ever in the mood for something a little more mellow, but not a heavy as a flavored latte or mocha, a cup of Hazelnut coffee is the way to go.  I also like their strong sense of local-ism.  It is apparent that they want to support and encourage neighboring businesses.

Another major props to Smelly Cat for roasting their own beans.  This is really impressive and makes 36th Street smell AMAZING.  

Finally, I really like the atmosphere of Smelly Cat.  They have great outdoor seating (with fresh water for my pup) and a really cozy layout inside.  Smelly Cat welcomes and encourages resting and relaxing over a great cup of coffee, a good book and free wifi!

Probably the best latte in Charlotte. The espresso isn't overpowering or bitter, and they have lots of different syrups that you can try in your drink. I usually go for the toasted coconut. It isn't too sweet or fake tasting. Their pastries are great as well. They always have different seasonal things to try out. The baristas are always nice and the WiFi is fast. The seating isn't the greatest, but I've never had the issue of not being able to find a seat, even during the rush.

A good weather calls for a good cup of coffee .. 
Enjoying my cortado with a very fine company !  
This place offers good ambience and good music with great coffee. 
Also, I bought my first smelly cat coffee mug today :D

Went here because it was suggested to me from my cousins (who know I'm obsessed with FRIENDS) and I've been here at least 10 times in the past 4 years. Their coffee is good and they make a mean Chai Tea Latte! So good! Also their peanut butter brownie is amazing!!'
Awesome and friendly staff, helped me pick a great drink and taste some of the cold brews they had. Next time I am in Charlotte I will go again.
The perfect NoDa neighborhood coffee shop.  Free wifi, delicious coffee, ice cream, and delicious (even gluten free) snacks.

We stopped in here while in Noda and I loved the atmosphere of this place. It's dark and atmospheric, some place you could go to get work done. They have their roaster right out in the open which is awesome looking and the seating areas are separated by old doors. I had the hot chocolate and it was really great, super creamy and a good amount of chocolate.
This place is super cool with great customer service. We love to visit NODA and stop here. Frozen drinks today -spot on. You can also buy whole bean coffee they will grind it for you.
The best. I buy their ground coffee to make at home as well. I always recommend it to people and it never disappoint. Dirty Chai is my favorite!

Smelly Cat (or, Stinky Kitty, as I know it) is a great neighborhood coffee shop.  Small, semi-private booths, couches, and outdoor seating.
Bring your dog, or your laptop, or your friend... or meet some folks when you get there!

Either way, great place in NoDa!
Good coffee, good shakes, good pastries, good people, great atmosphere. I heart Smelly Cat!

I'm in love with the mom and pop coffee stores popping up in Charlotte and smelly cat is one of my favorites. The shop is inviting and charming, but their coffee is amazing! 

The cold press is perfect! No sugar or creamer is needed and the vanilla chai tea is to die for!!! They also have some tasty bakery goods. If you go on a early Saturday or Sunday morning you will be able to enjoy it right out of the oven. The zucchini bread is a favorite along with their morning glory bread-which contains cranberries, raisins, carrots and cinnamon!!!!
Great coffee, great service and nice environment.  Must try the Dirty Chai, pour over coffee and peanut butter bar is to die for.

Yummy coffee aromas greet you as you walk through the door along with a cheery hi. Service is knowledgeable and friendly.

The free WiFi is always appreciated though the space is a bit tight. Coffee and tea selections were good and prepared well. If more places around here were open for lunch I'd be here more often than I'd like. As it is I treat myself to their fast efficient service whenever I happen to be around the area in the daytime instead.

What's more could you ask for from a neighborhood coffee shop other than maybe an awesome name? Oh wait it's got that too!

I don't drink coffee, but they have the best hot chocolate in Charlotte.  I'll slap you if you think Starbucks hot chocolate is even average.  

Also, they do have a private lot. I'm not sure why 2 people said you can only park on the street...

Was visiting Charlotte over the long weekend and was really happy to find Smelly Cat open on a Sunday night and full of people. As someone who can drink coffee and go directly to sleep, I love a good late-night coffee shop. My cortado was perfect, the music was awesome and had me Shazam-ing more than one song, the baristas were super friendly and fast. Wish I could bring this place back to Brooklyn with me!

Smelly Cat has the best coffee in CLT. Hands down their Black Cat Blend and Triple Threat Espresso are the richest roasts, the most delightfully dark beans you'll get in the Queen City. This mind blowing coffee has always been fresh when I've stopped by for a pick me up and is served up by a friendly staff who are always warm and welcoming. It's a cute place too!

i came in today thurs the 19th at 1:15 and ordered some chais. They were pretty good but unfortunately the barista who took our order and made our drinks came
off very snarky and condescending which i didn't appreciate. This isn't the only time she has been like that, she's waited on me a few other times with the same better-than-you attitude

Love this spot - and managed to hit it at a time this afternoon when it was not packed.  We had great coffee, and a great time sitting inside talking and coloring with the provided crayons, including the one with the color name "pissen lit", which kept me amused for my entire visit! (french for the dandelion color).  I love the decor which is very cool, and the opportunity to chill for a bit in a with great company, great coffee and the pissen lit crayon!
The customer service is impressive. The coffee is mediocre, but they keep me going back. They're always helpful and friendly, and the vibe of the place is great.
Great cup of coffee. Fresh roasted, service was quick and friendly.  Not much seating if you want to hang around there.

When I first moved to Charlotte I did not know about NoDa, so when 55 scoped this place out he told me I would like it.  He was correct!  This is a cool place with cool customers and Cools as customers which is important in this particular situation!

I like the Espresso and I like the Hot Chocolate even more!  The Staff is always very friendly and have always been successful in making something good for me!

The inside of this place is as cool as the patrons who like hanging out here.

Great coffee drinks, awesome friendly staff, chill comfortable atmosphere and good music. Delicious baked goods with gluten-free options. Wide selection of board games. Outdoor patio and wi-fi, you can't ask for much more in a coffee shop. Private lot parking adjacent.

I love their drinks and their staff.  Unique artwork on the walls, sometimes available for purchase.  Seating is somewhat cramped.

They also have a drum circle outside every Friday from 8:00PM to 2:00AM.
Hip little joint. Had an excellent New Orleans style cold brew--exactly what I didn't know I wanted. Staff was sweet and helpful. Perfect place to while away an hour or two.

This NoDa staple is everything you'd want a coffee house to be.  It is quaint, eclectic, cozy, and it has some of the best coffee you can get anywhere in Charlotte.  As you walk in you'll notice a cabinet with board games so you can grab a cup and hang out for as long as you please while taking a trip down memory lane with a nostalgic game of Battleship.  You'll also notice the tables and booths around the place that make for perfect spots to chill or converse with friends.  

The coffee is as fresh as it gets.  You can't miss the roaster where all the magics happens right there near the counter.  You can get all kinds of fancy hot or iced drinks or keep it simple with a cup of the Tanzanian brew (my personal favorite). 

And the folks there are friendly and unpretentious.  They're helpful if you have questions or wish to venture outside the box to try something new.  Remember to tip!

If you visit NoDa and want the true experience that sums up the soul of the neighborhood, you must stop in here!

Coffee selection is amazing!  I just wish they had as good of a selection of parking spots. We had to resort to street parking.  Once inside, the environment is quirky and eclectic.  The space was cozy, although at times felt a tad too small.  My friends and I went to Smelly Cat to work on a project.  As soon as we arrived, we realized that this wasn't the kind of coffee house you could be productive at.  Due to the size restrictions, which hence, make the table sizes smaller, we had to enjoy our delicious coffee and relocate.  

Service was friendly and the atmosphere was super chill.  I'd go back for some schmooze time!

Worst service ever!!! Was really surprised to say the least. The young lady at the cash register was rude unwilling to correct the order. Whatever you do do not expect to get a real Cuban café I tried to explain that what they were serving was not a Cuban café she became insulting to my culture as I just wanted to exchange the café to something else needless to say I will not go back if that's how they treat customers I went during evening hours and I will not suggest anyone else does that's looking for a Cuban café but hey if you want a bad attitude, and terrible service then this is the place for you

Always a great experience at this wonderful mom and pop coffeehouse.  The baristas are all very friendly and the drinks are great.  I am a big fan of the iced Sweet New Orleans and the Chai tea. Also, it is hard to make a visit there without a slice of the Zucchini bread; it is so delicious.

Staff is friendly and coffee is delicious, what more can you ask for!? 

Great spot to grab a coffee, sit out in the sun and relax.

This place definitely delivers when you are looking for a neat little coffee shop in a new town.  I was around the Charlotte area for an interview and I love exploring coffee shops in new places.  

I loved the local art hung up on the walls and the earthy feel of the place.  The people who work there were super cool too - the guys behind the counter gave me a lot of great recommendations.  Not only do they sell awesome coffee drinks there but they also serve alcohol - unfortunately I could not imbibe.  I got their pumpkin spice latte and it was amazing.  I also brought some work with me and was able to be productive in my quiet corner of the shop.

Definitely check this place out if you need somewhere to chill downtown!

Quite an adorable coffee establishment and the only one in the neighborhood (it seemed) on a Saturday at 11am. Service is friendly and the line moves pretty quickly. 

The chai latte I ordered was decent. A little heavy on the milk and not so much chai flavor, but still an ok choice. I would probably order a latte the next time around though. My friend went with the peach smoothie, which she said was "okay" too. 

I bought a mixed berry scone to go with the latte, which actually turned out to be rather disappointing. The texture of the scone was mushy rather than crumbly and the mixed berry flavor was faint. They didn't have a good selection of pastries (which was slightly disappointing). My almost $7 breakfast was an "A-ok" in my book, so 3 stars it is!

One of the staples of NoDa that I finally got around to checking out this morning. I was in the neighborhood looking at a house and figured I would swing by on this beautiful day, get a coffee, and do some reading! I did not get adventurous on my selection, just a regular latté, but when the latté is delicious there is no need to get experimental.

The inside is very cozy with some small tables for 2-4 people and some comfy chairs as well. Like I mentioned, I sat outside where there is also a lot of seating (probably more than inside). You can always tell the popularity of a place by the audience they serve. All sorts of people went in and out of Smelly Cat in the time I was there, and I loved it. Nothing brings people together like coffee!
great atmosphere. nice and small and cute. not a lot of traffic coming in and out not noisy

Maybe a take out of Friends the TV show yet this is a TRUE coffee house! Nestled in the artsy part of Charlotte called Noda, this place embodies what an independent coffee house should be like. Great coffee and atmosphere!  I will be back many times.

This was a great place to stop for coffee while visiting Charlotte. The owner stopped to chat with us and showed us the coffee roaster. Overall very friendly atmosphere and great coffee. Highly recommend!

After trying all of the big hitters, I would rank Smelly Cat as the best coffee in town. The location oozes edgy, which partly comes with being right in the heart of NoDa. The baristas all ad to the vibe with the friendly quirky natures, and possess the ability to make a sublime latte. They usually have Ethiopian blends which is my personal favourite thing about Smelly Cat, but they also have a lot of other unique brews from all around the world which makes each visit seem like a new adventure.

Nice coffee shop located in NODA. I had the iced dirty chai which was good. My husband had their Costa Rica pour over which he felt was ok. They roast their own beans. Seating is limited and an outlet was not working but other than that everything was clean and staff was nice!

My boyfriend and I were in Charlotte for the Spartan this past weekend. We stopped here for coffee and sat inside since it was raining. Love the atmosphere here. The baristas were all very nice. They let me try their different cold brews before deciding on one. 
The music was on point. 90s throw backs. Really can't ask for much more from a coffee shop. The coffee itself wasn't the best Ive ever had, but the location and atmosphere made up for it. 

Usually there is a Farmers Market behind here that runs on Saturdays. We were going to try and check it out but it was raining so no one showed up. Super bummed!

I love coffee...but more than that I love a unique atmosphere and supporting local businesses.  They make the best Chai...whether u get it iced or hot, in Charlotte. I have found myself waking up on a weekend and craving Smelly Cat...it truly makes the start of a nice weekend.  They have some bakery items for sale..but not a big selection;  I have tried the banana nut muffin and it's quite yummy. The staff is fun and I love that they use the Ipad when u check out...so tech savvy!
I hope I can stop in sometime this week!

I went to this coffee shop simply bc its name caught my eyes. It's located in the Noda area (which parking can be such a chaos), but it has its own private parking lot  that's a huge plus. Also free wifi too!!!!
