The shop has a very cozy fell to it, and has about 10 small tables inside and outside. It also has its own roasting machine, I guess that's a big plus for HUGE coffee fan. Personally I like my coffee sweet and strong like cuban coffee. However, I made the mistake of ordering a Hazelnut cold brew. I mean don't get me wrong I still like it, but I prefer some sugar to it.

I came here to do a little research, since we haven't install internet at our place yet. After sitting there 3 hours, I decided to order a Chai iced latte and lemon poppy muffin. The latte is pretty good, but didn't stand out to me as a MUST have in my drink list.

I will definitely go back for the extremely friendly staff, and to try the cuban coffee in a colder weather.

Went this morning to meet up with some friends for coffee.

The place is relatively small which makes it difficult for groups but great for studying or getting some work done. That is if you can keep your attention off of the interesting characters passing through. 

If I want to escape my boring, finance job, jcrew lifestyle and hang out with shirtless Longboarders doing yoga and praying to rocks, this is definately my go to place.
Great cozy work spot, but very little in the way of food.  Just pastries and bagels.

I went to breakfast at Smelly Cat Coffee with my boyfriend and we really enjoyed ourselves. We ordered a sausage, egg and cheese biscuit and a bacon, egg and cheese burrito. The burritos and biscuits are homemade but premade; if you come later in the morning the options may be limited and you made need to ask them to reheat your meal. The biscuit itself was outrageously good. The burrito was not particularly special, although the bacon was cooked nicely.

The coffee menu is extensive and clearly well thought-out. There are hot and cold preparations, as well as pour-over options. You can sample the coffees which helps with decision-making. My white chocolate mocha left much to be desired; it tasted like raspberry for some reason. The mocha flavor is why I docked a star, since it is a coffee shop after all!

Smelly Cat Coffee ROCKS the interior. You walk in and feel immediately transported to the hippest part of Brooklyn (or should I say "hipsterest"?). The ceilings are covered in burlap sacks for coffee beans, nooks are formed with reclaimed wood (each has an outlet so that you can utilize their free Wi-Fi), a giant old-school coffee grinder provides an amazing focal point, and the walls are even faux exposed brick. There is a LOT going on but it all works together to provide a clever and cohesive ambience perfect for weekend relaxing, weekday (small) meetings, or even grabbing a quick cup to-go. There is a darling porch area with outdoor seating options. Smelly Cat Coffee is extremely animal friendly.

We will be returning to Smelly Cat Coffee to try some new items. It would be great for a long, yummy Saturday morning with a crossword puzzle.
A number of good coffee houses in CLT but Smelly Cat my fav. NODA parking always a challenge but goes with the turf.

The best almond milk latte that I've ever had in my life. Creamy and smooth. The ambience and staff were perfection. I would fly from Palm Springs just for this coffee again! Sad to not spend more time here! You will not regret your visit here!

I used to spend many a day here during my first two years as new Charlotte resident but Sunday was my first time back in about a year. I can't remember what I used to order all those times but I am now a fan of their ever-popular iced dirty chai latte (with almond milk). Is it too far of a stretch for me to say that Smelly Cat is pretty close to being considered hipster-ish?  

In my experience, the employees are and always have been very knowledgeable and willing to break down any and all aspects of a drink. I've found that it's easier to ask about certain things than relying on the menu that's posted. Availability of some things change plus they're usually adding food items. On Sunday morning when I visited, they had scones, muffins, sausage/bacon & egg biscuits, and bagels - all made in-house. Maybe because it's the South, but I just don't see the need for a coffee shop to sell biscuit sandwiches. I skipped the food this time and happily sucked down my drink.

The dirty chai latte was/is delicious!!! The medium was $5.71 but I don't think it's that much more than what you would pay for the same drink at Starbucks. I loved that they prepared it with crushed ice and there was no need for any additional sweetener. The chai spice they use settles down at the bottom so be sure to give your drink a good shake before you take your first sip.

There are so many different drinks and coffee concoctions they that I look forward to continuing to drink my way around their menu!

Pretty awesome place!!  The coffee is great!!  I had the iced toasted coconut latte!!  The flavor was great and it gave me the kick I needed!  The service was also very nice!  I'm definitely going back!
Won't bother with this place ever again. Over it. Asked for light ice because the first time I ordered an iced chai it was packed with ice and very little chai. Same BS. $4.75 cup of ice. Expensive.

Loved this place so much that I bought a sweatshirt! They have amazing cold brew and a great, cozy atmosphere! Around the building is a lot of neat street art that it necessary to check out. They're quick and their cold brew is amazing!

Pretty good ! Rated 4 stars instead of 5 just because I reserve 5 stars for the absolute best places. I love their coconut iced lattes. They never get the whipped cream right. Parking is hit or miss. Really cute atmosphere in and outside.

I'm actually kind of heartbroken that I've lived in Charlotte for so long and never made it out here until today.  This place is awesome, it's the exact kind of coffee-haven that Charlotte needs more of, and it's situated in the cool streets of Noda.  The staff is helpful and engaging, the atmosphere is really conducive to quality conversations but also provides great space for someone who needs to plop down and grind out some work.  More importantly though - my drink was fantastic, and their in house bagels are phenomenal!  This place could definitely be my new go-to coffee place.

Smelly Cat is an awesome NoDa hangout. The artsy decor includes doors that have been placed to create little nooks for several of the tables. 
They offer free wireless and plenty of coffee drinks and snacks. I typically get a chai latte, but if you're looking for more of a dessert, the chai shake is really good too. I love sitting outside reading a book and enjoying a coffee on a nice day.

No odorific felines here. Just solid coffee and a quaint, comfy coffee shop. Loved looking at the art that lined the beautiful, exposed brick walls.

They roast there own beans on a beautiful, red drum roaster right next to the counter. So you can get super freshly roasted beans to take home. 

Their prices are really good and their offerings diverse. I'm really looking forward to trying more of their menu... I might need a Cuban coffee soon!

Support local business. Check this place out.

Smelly Cat is busy as all hell, and while it makes enjoying the place a bit of a pain sometimes, you should also take it as a sign that it is not to be missed.  I travel to CLT a fair amount, and Smelly Cat is the only place that is on my must stop list of coffee houses in the city.
Very good cup of joe. Love the atmosphere here and prices aren't bad. Not sure if they serve food but if so its probably delicious
Awesome coffee, the breakfast burrito was great and the comfortable ambience was lovely! Lots of friendly dogs!

One of the best lattes I've ever had!  I love everything from the fact that I could get almond milk to the smell of the roasting beans they prepare on sight. The coffee Roast was obviously a perfected art here!

I am an out of town-er; we came to eat at the NOLA themed restaurant across the street and the waitress recommended this place for more variety of coffee. I had a hot chocolate with 2 shots of espresso. It was better than ANY mocha I've ever had! I love that they use ghiradelli chocolate for their drinks! If I lived in charlotte this would be a favorite for sure.

One of the coolest coffee places I've been to.  Love the repurposed doors for booths.  Great WiFi.  People talking and and playing games. The place makes you feel at ease and want to chat it up with the locals.  PLUS they use Square on their iPad for card processing... nerds will understand that one.  Oh, and the soy latte I had was great.  Oh, Oh, and the service was great everyone seemed to be happy to be there and work together.  *sigh* love

After being contacted by the owner through Yelp, I had to up my rating. This is my local coffee shop, and I thought I loved it before, my biggest complaint being they do not serve breakfast sandwiches. 

Well not too long after writing my review the owner contacted me via message letting me know they have added B'fast wraps to the menu!! Stopped in to grab a bacon, egg & cheese and a Kona brew, and left a very happy camper. 

This is the difference between local business and corporations, GOOD local business listen to the needs/wants of their consumer and adapt. 

Kudos Smelly Cat, and thank you Cathy!

Great coffee, fun atmosphere, and the staff were super friendly. We stopped here on our way to an event around the corner, and it was great. Their specialty is the dirty chai (chai tea w/1, 2, or 3 shots of espresso). We really liked it.
Great place .. Good strong coffee . Was told by the girl at the counter everything g is made here -- even the coffee beans are roasted on the premises.

This was my first visit to this famous NoDa neighborhood coffee shop. Following most Yelper's recommendation, I tried the hot 'dirty chai' and definitely enjoyed it, although it didn't leave me jumping for joy. It came in a really small cup, maybe 10 ounces ( which is okay with me) Maybe I should try it iced? Not sure. 

The restaurant itself is a unique, quirky , funky type of place that would like to park myself in to read a book, do some homework, or write some Yelp reviews.  It's very narrow inside, but they got creative with the seating: single person alcoves along the wall, bar seating at the front window, seating outside in the front, and on the sides of the building. There is even a curvy bar from which I believe at some point in the day they serve beer on tap ( local brewery creations included). 

Saturday morning was pretty crowded inside, but I will certainly be making a trip back, maybe when it's not so busy.

Smelly Cat has become my de facto office this semester since I can't seem to find anybody to give me a real one. I'm in Smelly Cat right now...I love it here.

The staff is friendly, and the decor is fun. I love the doors. I wish there were a few more plugs for the laptops, and a few more food offerings would be nice...but I can handle these little defects. The coffee is good, and you can sit here for hours without anyone bothering you.
being a professional coffeesnob.  This made me happy.  Great service, the best cap in Charlotte, and a great place to hang out.  I went to all the coffeehouses in Charlotte this won!!

Top notch coffee and fantastic baristas! They roast all their own coffee in-house and do a great job. I thought decaf and cold brew coffee were both sacrilege, until I tried the Peruvian (get it as a pour over, Leah knows her shit!), Snickerdoodle, and Hazelnut. Also, just try a pour over with any of the roasts, it'll open your eyes to a whole new level of coffee goodness!
I didn't watch Friends so the reference was lost on me, but damn was that an amazing dirty chai! The entire shop was cool and I recommend it. I really like NoDa.

The best part of this place is the decor. Their coffee, I've heard (from coffee loving friends) that it was not good. But personally I'm a Chai tea lover, and their chai tea is very very bad. It's powder based and very bad. But it has a cool vibe, I'd probably go for a tea (can't go wrong with hot water and a tea bag).

Hands down Charlotte's best dirty chai. Good vibes in here! One of my most fav places to get coffee here in the Queen City, located right in rad noda. Grab a coffee - chill inside, or go walk around and get weird.

Smelly Cat is a decent coffee shop. The main thing it has going for it is the ambiance, it is a very nice spot. The coffee is good, nothing to rave about. I would give Smelly Cat a better review if they had a better food selection, though their muffins are my favorite it isnt enough.

We love the Smelly Cat! The antique rustic atmosphere is very hip and the employees are extremely helpful. We tried there version of a frap and loved it. Once weekly we drive forty five minutes to the cat house and find it very relaxing.

This is one of the best coffee shops in Charlotte! I have been going to Smelly Cat since 2012, and I keep going back there at least once a week. The baristas are always friendly and they have a great sense of humor, the atmosphere is great, it is beautifully decorated, and the coffee is amazing!

I went here with my aunt who I am visiting. She had been raving about it for a while. I was pleasantly surprised by the cute decoration on the outside and all the outdoor seating. It was around dusk when we went so all the outdoor lights were on as well which added to the ambiance. 

The inside did not disappoint either. It had the neatest seating made from reused doors as well as regular tables. It was very cozy and private. 

The menu was diverse and they had a few little food items wrapped up for sale. I had a regular coffee and my aunt had a orange creamsicle milkshake. Both were very good. 

The service was efficient and fast. It was quiet and a great place to enjoy a book. I enjoyed this local little coffee shop and will for sure come back. A great little place to check out in NoDa!

Extremely cool, hip spot in an eclectic neighborhood. Grab your coffee and delicious pastry and walk the streets to people watch it view some cool murals. The coffee is delicious with house made syrups and of course, the baristas are knowledgeable and accommodating.

I ordered a Dirty Chai here and my life has never been the same since. When I sip on my daily, straight forward and unimaginative iced coffee, distant memories of espresso, chai, almond milk and crushed ice still dance in my mind. 

The truth is, I came here for the name. And because it was literally across the street from Yelp's Summertime Soiree at the Neighborhood Theatre across the street.

But boy am I glad they came up with a quirky name to hook and line me in there to experience that Dirty and take in the sights and scents of roasting coffee.
Cute coffee house with good coffee. All drinks served in to go cups. I'm kind of picky but like my drink in glassware when I go out to places like this for coffee.
A nice little hangout if it's a nice day and you just want to chill and have a cup of coffee.

Smelly Cat brings me joy.

Their coffee has never let me down. Hot fresh, roasty, toasty, creamy latte goodness.

Cute like a baby whose cheeks you want you squeeze.

Friendly like Labrador who wants to be petted behind his ears (sorry Kitty).

Perfectly located like a nose on your face (and in my favorite neighborhood).

A welcome beacon - a lighthouse that guides me to a caffeinated night cap before my journey home.

Gracias, mi amigo, Smelly Cat.

Smeelllly cat, Smeeelllly cat, whaat aaare theey feeeeding yoou?  - in my Phoebe voice.  

I always have the 'Smelly  Cat' song stuck in my head when I grab a cup of coffee here before breaking out my laptop to get some work done at this cozy shop. It's a good thing 'cause this place always perks me up.


Now, I'm going to spill the beans:

Pleasant pour-overs
Freshly roasted coffeee
Tip top tea (I like mine Green, aren't you envious ;-)
Exellent Espressos (try the new Con-Panna)
No bake brownie (nuff said)
Friendly baristas
Free Wi-Fi.

Plus, you gotta try the place out because it's a NoDa staple.

Unique. The decorations of cats inside the place really pay tribute to the name. The baristas were all very friendly and warm. It's a bit dark and small inside but they provide great seating outside if that isn't your scene. 
They gave me quick service and my cubano was delicious. 
The area is very cute with several other places to walk around and shop. 
They also had wonderful baked goods for sale 

They have a good amount of seating :-)

My Experience: Lucky I guess reading other reviews, but I drive right up to a parking space beside the building. However, I can see there could be a problem in parking. Especially, if you are not familiar with this area like me. 

This coffee shop is small with inside seating as well as outside seating. It's completely comfortable once you find a seat inside. Outside Seating looks like it would be the place to sit at if the weather is nice and not hot like is right now on this late June day.

They do have WiFi but the password must be given to you at time of checkout. The password is something weird. The cashier wrote it down on a piece of napkin but I couldn't read her hand writing. So I took my IPhone 7 to her and she typed it in for me. She also did my MacBook Air. So, that's great customer service.

How Discovered:  I found this place because I use the Yelp App. I hit directions to take me here but it was wanting me to use a path that included a road closed. I believe it was 36th Street. So, I redirected my Yelp GPS and I finally got here on a Sunday morning just before noon. 

Menu item ordered:  I studied the Yelp listing, reviews and photos taken and decided on the toasted coconut frappe with whip cream. It's a cold sweet drink with caffeine that is perfect for this time of year in early Summer.  It was delicious and was so good that it was gone within a few minutes.

Final Thoughts: I really like this coffee shop. Yes, I would come back if in area. A lot of college age students were at this coffee shop while I was here.  Now, there are several colleges and Universities close by and it looks like when the students visit this business when they are not in class. Also, when looking outside down the street the visit other local establishments close by too.

If I'm ever having a bad day, I always make a point to come over to Smelly Cat for an iced soy dirty chai latte. The baristas are always happy and make a point to ensure your experience from the time you enter the shop to the time you leave with your coffee is positive. The chai is not a syrup like some of the independent coffee shops in Charlotte and is made to order. They also have yummy biscuit sandwiches and breakfast burritos if you can get there early enough. Lots of seating inside and out and a great location if you just want to take your coffee to go and walk around NoDa. Even though they sell something as simple as coffee, their passion and amount of care they put in to their drinks really does make a difference. Smelly Cat is one of the examples I give when people ask what I love about living in Charlotte.

If you like the ambience of a coffee shop than you will like this place.  The only minus is it very small so you won't be able to sit.  They roast their own coffee which in general is a plus for a shop. I had a white chocolate mocha and my girlfriend had a dirty chai latte both had great flavor. I would recommend this place to anyone who loves coffee it is worth your time! They also have stand up comedy which is cool but again it very had have 15 people in the place since it is so small.

I walked in after work and was quickly soothed by Bob Marley tunes and a fresh Ethiopian Coffee.  There is reading material all around, which is definitely a must have.  The joint looks like a brick storage unit that was painted by a bunch of hippies and decorated by cat lovers.  There are comfy seats throughout and booths if you arrived with friends.  

They change their coffee specials daily and they range from Decaf to Dark, and they are all delicious.  I heard the Mango Smoothies are a delicious treat as well.  I gotta try one next time around.  

I also thought that the outside seating was well decorated with homemade wind chimes and trees for shade during those hot Charlotte afternoons.  I liked it so much that I should have left a tip at the bar, but I was a little broke.  Woops.
Best coffee  I have had , cute place, nice hard working staff, definitely will be going here often.
I absolutely love Smelly Cat!  I generally get an iced white mocha.  My favorite thing to get there is the Cheddar and Chive Scone.  It is delicious!

I had the White Mocha and it was delicious. Love the atmosphere.I love that it the place has the same name as phoebes smelly cat song. The inside is so cool. To me it looks Friends inspired. I loved it.
Friendly service and a great cup of Joe!

The owners were just as warm and welcoming as their coffee  I enjoy a nice almond milk latte and they were able to accommodate my desire. They make their flavored syrups in house, and boy were they a treat! I had the maple brown sugar as did my friend. She considered it to be the best coffee she'd ever tasted! The space was quaint and cozy, a great place to wake up and start the day! Overall, this was the perfect coffee house for our Charlotte visit.

Cute as a button tucked into the pocket of the heart of NoDa, and full of the quirky but laissez-fare vibe that makes the neighborhood so special.  I mean, where else can you come in for espresso and sit next to a neighbor's dog curled against a booth and lazily awaiting its owner's return?  Where else can you have chocolate truffles and coffee (a combination that needs to proliferate, in my humble view)?

Look, this little nook of a shop makes a good brew and has plenty of tempting eats to nosh on.  If you want to step away from the big chains and get to know your local shops and the neighbors, the Cat fits that bill.  Baristas know the regulars and if you will just talk to them, they will make your drink to fit your preferences too.  If it's not, tell them and they'll remake it.  

The wife and I like coming here if for no other reason than each trip is an experience- interesting people, interesting sights, and it feels like we find something new to try every time.  I recommend it to anyone who visits and encourage locals to go and support a local business doing it all right.

Like their Facebook page for notices of upcoming events and special products (not to mention a list of that days fresh brews).
Small coffee shop but cute. I don't enjoy being in here when it's really busy. Just not enough room to move around. They make a mean London Fog everytime I order it!!

In the midst of Charlotte's lackluster coffee scene, Smelly Cat stands out as one of the best. Their iced coffee is delicious, and the setting is always a great place to work. I've written many a college paper there.

Posting for a friend (because I'm a Smelly Cat fan and want to support these guys!) "I had not gone into Smelly Cat for over a year because I experienced extremely rude customer service. Despite my past experience, I decided to give Smelly Cat another try. Last Sunday, I went in and the staff was extremely personable! Best customer service since Leah left! I will gladly continue to enjoy this place in the future!"

Very cool !  Awesome little coffee shop in Charlotte North Carolina. Great coffee, cool relaxed atmosphere, you can even sit and get some work done if you want. The coffee is stellar ( try the Ethiopian ). Theme he has lots of great lite selections to grab and go if you need to. A must stop for coffee lovers when in Charlotte NC.

This place is still amazing. I am writing this as an update. I have been coming here for almost 3 years and it still never gets old. I just wanted to mention the new roaster. They roast their own COFFEE!!!!!!!!! This is such an amazing thing for a small coffee shop to have. It is such a creative niche. The quality of their coffee is the best in Charlotte. HAND DOWN!!!!. 

My favorite still is the dirty chai. 

I would like to mention something weird about this place which makes it very special. I applied to work here right before the DNC, and I got past the first interview. They told me that I would have to sign a contract that I would be able to work for at least a year in order to get the job. Due to being a college student, I couldn't get tied down for a year, but I love that they want their employees to stay for at least a year so that they gain a bond with the customers. I would love to work for a company/business like this in the future. 

There is also talk about getting their own bakery area. They are going to make all their baked goods in house. This place is going to be around for a long time.

Not enough stars! This is what you envision when your looking for a cool place to sit and enjoy a coffee. Although I love coffee, my first visit here I had a green tea because I also love green tea and I was already amping out on caffine....  I'm looking forward to my next visit  and have a cup of joe, as I'm confident that it will be as good as the tea. This area of Charlotte known as NoDa reminds me of South Street in Philly. Very cool/ seemingly nice people everywhere just doing their thing. This place is right in the epicenter. Came in feeling pretty shitty and left in a much better state of mind. Good music in the air, mellow lighting, nice muffins and other pastries and Strong wifi. I opened up my devices but found myself just enjoying the ambiance of this place and shut everything down and just chilled with my eyes closed for a while. I may become a regular. If your in NoDa check this place out. Btw...  unlike starbucks, you can order a SMALL- MEDIUM OR LARGE!
The. SWEETEST. STAFF. EVER.  These guys have all the right ingredients for creating a great coffee, business, and experience.  My hats off and wallet open to this business.

Pretty good, nice and quiet place. A bit small and crowded but it adds to the ambience and aesthetics if that's your sort of thing. The coffee is decent, some are better than others. It's not a Starbucks type of thing. Strong black coffee and maybe some fancy mixed coffees here and there.

Beautiful Sunday morning, artsy little cafe, sun shining, hot sweet chai, people enjoying the day inside and out. The door partitions between booths are just as cool as other reviewers said. I look forward to trying other beverages and hanging out...

Beware of HIDDEN FEES!!! If you like to get the Cuban coffee they are charging you an extra $1.50 for sugar but they never tell you or have it posted on the menu. I have looked over my orders for the past 3 months and it's ridiculous all the hidden fees/charges. Also, the girl who took my order yesterday made a mistake when she gave me my order (I order cold brew, she gave me hot coffee) and then she charged me extra $2 to correct it, any other coffee shop would have corrected it for free since it was their mistake. I'm all about helping small business but they shouldn't take advantage of us.

If I have to spend some time in NODA, drink coffee, watch people, and work on my stuff on the internet/laptop, then this is the place.

NODA got some characteristics and this place completes the NODA neighborhood. The outside seating is not great if it's cold but in the warm weathers it's the best to sit outside, as long as the sun is not shining directly on you. Inside, the chairs and sofa chairs are comfortable. Few tables are setup in such a way that it feels like an intimate setup. 

Main thing - the coffee is great. The barristas are friendly and helpful with any tips regarding coffee.

I am a big coffee drinker. If I am in NODA and have time for coffee then I know where to go.

After living in Charlotte for over 10 years, I finally had coffee at Smelly Cat. Based on that one experience, I'd say 5 stars. The drip coffee was good, the cheddar and chive scone was good, the service was good. All in a all a good coffee shop experience. It's not super convenient to me and there's about 8,000 coffee shops between my house and this location. But if you're in the area, or just curious to check it out, go for it!

I am not a coffee person, so if you're looking for a review about that, move on. I'm just here to say as a water drinker, this space is ok. The parking lot is small, so street parking is almost mandatory. The space inside is a bit cramped, but eclectic and fun. The menu does have some non coffee stuff, but the pricing? Ouch! I love the idea of you, but I'm never going to be a Smell Cat person..... ps: dogs are better! :D

One of my fav coffee places in Charlotte. You can smell the aroma right from their parking lot. 
We ordered a cortado and cappuccino...good mix of coffee and music ... loved the ambience and the currency wall...found a note from my country :p
Will definitely come again when in Noda
What a cool place to have a good cup of coffee! Loved it so much I bought a shirt!! It's small but a must try if you like cool coffee spots.
Funky little place. Been driving by here for ever and always wanted to stop. Friendly staff, typical coffeehouse menu. Got the toasted coconut frappé. YUMMO!! I'll have to stop in more often.
This is one of my favorite spots in Charlotte! Best mocha frapp I've ever had. Love, love, love this place!

Facts:
- Phoebe Buffay does NOT work here! 
- Charming and cozy coffee house.
- Offers pour over, cold brews, specialty espresso beverages, or caramel apple ciders.
- Selection of breakfast bites, pastries, and fresh bagels.
- Indoor and outdoor seatings.

Great spot.
Four and Half Yelps.

No Da at its best.  Small place, big prescences in the No Da hood.  Indoor and out door seating, plenty to eat and drink.

Parking can be a challenge, but when you want to get away from the Restaurant and bar scene in this part of town, Smelly is the way to go.

Be it coffee or tea, ice cream, or pastries, they have a little something for everyone.

During warmer months they also live music outside.  Throw in a Friday gallery art crawl and it is both a nice place to start and finish such an evening.
It was good experience .  It was something new and favorable , I am not a big fan of coffee or tea but it's a good spot if you enjoy that . The best part is the interior and atmosphere . I liked it .

I absolutely loved this little coffee shop in the Noda district of Charlotte. The space is a little tight but theres a great atmosphere here to make up for it and provide such a cozy coffee shop vibe! Outside seeing is available with some quirky art painted on the side of the building and some cute lights strung above the table area. Inside is set up with recycled materials and seemed like a nice place to set up a lap top and sit down and do work, but the weather was way to nice to not enjoy the outdoors and watch people walking to and from the farmers market.
Their customer service was great too! If you seem quizzical in trying to make up your mind on what to order they are all there to help you decide! I ordered an iced hazelnut latte but was sad when i found out they don't carry hazelnut and the woman helped me find an even better flavor; toasted coconut! it was delicious and well made and kept me going all day! I am so happy that Noda had this little oasis to stop by that was a good break from brewery tours and pizza shops!

Smelly Cat Coffee House is everything I love about local coffee place.  They have a relaxing vibe, a cozy, eclectic space, friendly staff, and some darn good coffee drinks.

I have ventured to this place a couple of times now.  I had a coffee drink the first time and a chai the second time.  Their coffee good; smooth, not bitter at all.  The chai was great as well.  Where some coffee places make their drinks too hot, both times my drinks were at the perfect temperature for immediate consumption.  I also had one of their big cranberry orange muffins, which was moist and not tart at all.  

The space is cozy, with a few tables around.  It has a rustic, artistic feel to it.  The staff has been friendly, always striking up conversation.  It feels very inviting here.

I only wish I lived a little closer.

Smelly Cat is such a cool, cute coffee shop. The "smack your mama" cake is delish and the tea selection, while a little high priced, is wide. I came here with my mom and a friend and even though there were 3 of us, we had to sit in the little booths made of recycled wooden doors, hung with local art. Magic!
Smelly Cat Coffee is cute, laid back, and open late! We love stopping in for a cappuccino and walking NoDa at night. The staff is friendly, and the coffee/espresso tastes great!

This is my favorite coffee shop by far. I love walking a few blocks to this cool atmosphere. Always friendly staff and the coffee hasn't been bad yet. Very fresh and satisfying. Have tried almost everything on their menu and have been impressed with the quality. Great prices and with the best coffee drinkers to hang out around.

Located in the NoDa (North of Davidson) district of Charlotte, NoDa began its rebirth in the 80's after the areas last mill closed in 1975. Artists with a vision of creating a new fringe arts district are off to a good start, opening several shops and restaurants bordering 36th Street and North Davidson. Among those businesses is Smelly Cat, a locally owned coffee shop that aside from coffee, serves sandwiches and other snack items including a uber yummy peanut butter pie. 

Small booths are constructed of used doors and the overall decor is rustic with a sprinkling of cat items throughout, there is outdoor seating as well as a small parking lot to the side of the building.

While NoDa is a bit out of the way, it is one of the more interesting neighborhoods in Charlotte and Smelly Cat is a fun addition to this district.  The first and third Friday of each month brings out the free "Gallery Crawl", where the galleries stay open late in the evening.
Trendy little shop with great coffee and awesome atmosphere.  I'm a big fan of the iced llorona on tap however, sometimes there are out but I can easily find a replacement cup of Joe.

Every time I come in here, the girls are so sweet and cheery in a genuinely welcoming way. I feel like a friend to them, and man is that nice. Their drinks are really lovely. My favourite beans are light roasts, which they don't really favor, but even still their coffee and lattes are pretty good. Coffee never tastes burnt (which is rare in this industry). They take pride in roasting their own beans and do a solid job of it. The atmosphere is homey and rustic. That is what I love. Well crafted coffee and a homey setting that screams "oh come, ye masses of chaotic lives, come and sit and just be."

Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I moved to Charlotte 3 1/2 years ago from Illinois. I don't know why it's taken me 3 1/2 years to find a wonderful coffee shop but HOT DAMN I found one! My coworker and I got frape's today - I got a coconut frape and she got a peanut butter frape. My life is changed. I have seen the coffee heavens with my own eyes through this coffee. Thank you to whomever opened this store and thank you for making delicious coffee. I am so happy I can now support a local coffee business instead of being disappointed at the big-box coffee shops. Thanks again - I'll be a regular customer any time I'm in NoDa.

Tasty French Roast coffee? Super cool and friendly staff (this time)? AND not many hipsters clogging up the inside? Man oh man this is WAY more my speed.

I sat in a corner sipping my coffee (and guiltily chowing down on a cranberry muffin) and retaking in the place. Sure, the walls still had ears (and some overpriced artwork), but I actually could sit and think and write. Then about 30 minutes later, one of my friends dropped in and some of the stories she was telling I could tell the MacBook guy was listening quite intently.

While sitting in there, I heard The Decemberists, Temper Trap, and a bunch of other Leanne-approved alternative bands. Definitely an improvement of last time too.

Thank you Smelly Cat for a pleasant experience, I'll be back!

(oh yeah, and Props for the Yelp sign at the counter AND the one on the door!)

It's so difficult to find places that allow my baby Paris (maltipoo dog) in that serves fresh and tasty goodies. Exploring Charlotte I came across this cute spot and from the name I figured they would have no problem letting him in. 
Cute outside seating, cozy rustic inside, and the customer service was top notch. Visited on a Sunday and it wasn't crazy busy but there were about 4 tables filled inside, while only 1 table, besides mine was taken outside. Ordered the iced Mojito Green Tea, and got too excited when I saw a gluten free peanut butter bar! Yesssss and it was OH SO DELICIOUS! Definitely the perfect spot for relaxing, getting work done, reading a book. This is not a place for a massive study group but stop in being 3 friends and order that peanut butter bar! I could've shared mine.... But naa =)

Made a quick stop into Smelly Cat Coffee on Monday afternoon. I went with a Toasted Coconut Frappe.

Quality
Smelly Cat Coffee was a necessary last stop before leaving Charlotte. Desperate for a boost of energy, we decided coffee was the answer. Feeling adventurous, I decided to go with a more elaborate Toasted Coconut Frappe. And while I did enjoy the milkshake-like coffee drink, it quickly became too much sweetness for me. Good in a small dose, but definitely something to share. I think I would have opted for a more traditional selection if given another chance. 

Quantity
My Frappe was very large and maybe a little too much for one person. I ended up handing it off to my girlfriend about two-thirds through.

Value
My drink was about $5, which seemed like a decent deal for a specializeed drink.

Ambiance
Smelly Cat Coffee is located in the NoDa area of Charlotte. In an area full of live music venues, old school theaters, and rows of little shops and restaurants, the coffee house fits right in. Outside they have plenty of tables and chairs set up to enjoy a beautiful day. Unfortunately the weather was not behaving and with little shelter outside was not an option. So, we ended up inside, which at first felt cramped, but after a short rush, felt more cozy. In terms of decor the shop is busy, with things everywhere, mostly related to coffee. They had a bar near the front, several tables in the center space, and then a few uniquely crafted enclosed tables on each wall. The larger back area was reserved for making and serving coffee. The building felt like it had history in its bones, and while that adds charm, it was frustrating dealing with wall sockets that could not keep a charge and tables that were a little too rickety. In the background alternative rock music crooned over the speakers, which I also believed could use an upgrade.

Crowd
The place was busy on Monday afternoon, granted it was a holiday and I'm sure folks needed coffee to get going after a night out. The crowd seemed mixed between folks who had settled in with books, newspapers, and computers, and groups just grabbing coffee to go. It was a younger crowd and I got a very hipster vibe.

Service
The girls behind the counter were friendly and quick with drink preparation. Even during a rush, they seemed to have no issue in pushing out drinks fast.

Parking
The coffee shop is located in a small town center. And despite some construction going on, plenty of street spots were available.

Extra
Smelly Cat Coffee got the job done while searching for a pick me up in the NoDa area of Charlotte. And had the weather had been better, I believe I would have very much enjoyed sitting outside and sipping on my cool beverage. A place that probably needs more visits for a more complete analysis, but one with plenty of charm and solid coffee.

Smelly Cat is my new jam. Many reasons behind this, but number one amongst them is THEY ROAST THEIR OWN COFFEE. I haven't non-single brew coffee this good since SoCal. And believe me, freshly roasted coffee is seriously good. Earthier, smoother, more flavorful.

But the coffee is not the only reason you should visit Smelly Cat. They carry first-rate snacks from premium local bakers, including some incredible gluten free options. I sprang for the gluten free peanut butter brownie and OMFG was it good.

There's also an awesome patio area in the front where you can hipster-watch in NoDa. Those hilarious hipsters, always up to some sort of hullabaloo or haberdashery.

You should go to Smelly Cat for all of these reasons. I look forward to exploring their shop again.
Always have great service and choices for new coffees. Cool vibe. Love this neighborhood stop for a good cup of coffee.

I love this place, their frappes and coffee are so good!

Also, the location is right in the middle of NoDa & they have nice outdoor seating
Best coffee I've ever tasted! Being able to watch them roast the beans right in front of me was pretty cool as well.

Hands down the best coffee shop in Charlotte, and one of my favorites anywhere. Staff is incredibly nice and welcoming, atmosphere is fabulous, and it's in a really cool part of town. There's a nice variety of brews offered each day, and I've never had a bad cup. They roast their own coffee which is always a plus, not to mention a decent selection of pastries, beer, and wine. I'm not in Charlotte very often anymore, but whenever I'm there I try to stop by.
Good coffee, but great location and atmosphere. A must in NoDa

The coffee is unique, that's for sure. I visited here from the airport due to a caffeine headache, and sipped at my coffee as I traveled the two hours to Asheville. While I was there I tried other coffee shops, but I really missed the stuff I got here. On my way to the airport I stopped by here to grab another coffee and a bag of their beans. They have a giant in house roaster, so I got beans that were freshly roasted that day! They also support the local businesses in the area, so I'm a fan. The workers weren't exactly friendly, but for the good coffee it's worth it.
Smelly Cat features free wifi and friendly service. One of my favorite spots for an afternoon coffee and a laid back atmosphere!

Overall, I think supporting local business is among my top priorities. Which is why I continue to get coffee here when I can. Plus I really like the owners and their approach to being innovative in their business. But overall, it's not my favorite - the value of what you're getting compared to the cost always seems to be out of whack. The smell of the beans roasting is an instant no for me - I love the smell of coffee roasting, but this doesn't smell like coffee. Worst offense for me, though, is the parking situation - I will never understand how all the spaces are full, but no one is actually in the place. If I can't find parking, I usually just drive somewhere else.

I rarely drink coffee, usually when I'm making a long distance drive.

But I've had tea several times at the Smelly Cat. Not bad. Nice too that they gave me more hot water when I was done and I was able to use my tea bag for another cup.

The dessert was good as well as the sliced sandwich wraps.

The cons:

I once visited on a day that someone's child was allowed free reign. Like, I saw him playing in the seating area then running behind the counter TOUCHING things, no hand washing apparent. 

Um, no.

On my last visit -- which was my LAST visit -- there was a dog in the shop. Animals are lovely just not in a place where I'm paying to eat.

As a former pet owner, I know that even when animals are banned from the kitchen, animal FUR can never be banned from anywhere animals are allowed.

The hair floats on the smallest of breezes and deposits itself where ever it happens to land...

I recently moved to Charlotte and I have been looking for a local coffee shop with a homey and relaxing feel. Smelly cat is exactly that! It has a cool outside seating area to hang out with friends, a nice inside area to hang as well. I'm really liking the decor too. I wish there was a little more seating inside though. Really friendly staff too!
Great neighborhood coffee shop with delicious coffee and treats. Very cozy vibe and friendly staff. They have breakfast sandwiches now too.

Entered Smelly Cat for the second time in my life the other day (first visit was a group meeting back when I was getting my MBA, and I'm trying to block that craziness from my mind, so this review is only for my most recent visit). 

What a wonderful little coffee shop. If I lived in NoDa, I would definitely support this small business instead of hitting up the big chains. The atmosphere is quite cool and laid back, and the staff was beyond wonderful. They had a ton of pastries and what looked like a mouth watering carrot cake, but I was there for one reason, and one reason only...caffeine.

Nicole W (being the fantastic community manager that she is) raved to me about the pour over coffee, so at Yelp's Passport to NoDa event earlier this week, I hightailed it over there to check it out. The wonderful Cathy (what a great name, huh?) walked us through the process of pour over coffee, which creates a very smooth cup o' joe. I thoroughly enjoyed the lesson and my caffeine - with some steamed almond milk and honey. Very, very good. If you have the time to wait, I highly recommend checking it out. 

And to support the business even further, I purchased a nice little pullover. There are t-shirts, sweatshirts, and other items for sale with the logo and location on them. I love me some quirky little gear. 

Head on in to Smelly Cat and sit inside if the weather isn't good, or grab one of the outdoor tables and soak up some vitamin D. Either way, you can feel good about supporting a small business in your area.

Short and sweet (okay not really but I'm a thorough person I guess). Point by point, at least:

+ Girl at register was unpleasant and aloof, but in a particularly unusual and rude way, not just in the stereotypical "aloof coffeeshop employee" way. I felt like I was actively burdening her with my presence even as I stood there quietly and patiently waiting for her to be ready to take my order. One star off. If I lived nearby, that interaction alone would put me off returning regularly. Not a good sign. 

+ Fella who handed me my drink? Pleasant and cheerful. Plus one. 

+ Iced dirty chai? Awesome! I love the crushed ice and weird spice thing (I can't totally describe it but it's like what would happen if someone crumbled a ginger/molasses-flavored Oreo wafer in the bottom of the cup) going on in it. Kind of wish there was a little more ice to cool it a bit longer, but that's not a true complaint because I'm a slow drinker. Plus two stars. 

+ As I was sitting outside minding my own business in this glorious weather (I live in Durham, decided to visit Charlotte on a whim) while texting my brother in Colorado, a member of a ministry student group(?) who was meeting outside decided to come up to me and try to "share something" with me. As a devout atheist, I actively discouraged him and he went away pretty quickly, but it was very unpleasant. After that interchange I left the warm sunny bench I was sitting on to retreat to my car. Minus half a star because I know this isn't the business's issue, but soliciting/proselytizing at customers should be actively discouraged. Not sure if this is a regular weekend meeting place for the group of fellows or if it was simply happenstance on this particular day.

+ Parking is confusing as fuck. I'm not familiar with Charlotte "this side of sign" parking and gave up on their terrifying(!) parking lot immediately and parked down the street. The weather was nice enough that I was fine with walking farther, but in crummier weather, I can't see doing it. Half a star off. 

Three stars. The drink was great, the ambiance less so. I will admit 100% that I went here based on name alone (and the picture of a drink with crushed iced, I guess).

Cute cafe with great selection of drinks. Could use more indoor seating but it has a great vibe for talking or studying. I wouldn't come here with more than one person at a time, but you can def enjoy a couple hours here easily.
Neat decor, cool booth ish places and pretty solid coffee. I didn't watch friends so I don't really get the name but i like it anyways.

Love the cat! The coffee is tasty, good variety of pastries, and the baristas are friendly.

In the summer I recommend the iced coffee. You can have plain or flavored iced coffee and the ice is slushy (like Sonic or Chickfila) so it's a nice surprise if you're used to the cubes at Starbucks or Dunkin.

Definitely sign up for a VIP account if you'll be stopping here often or you're social media savvy. Smelly Cat rewards it's VIPs with special treats (check Facebook or Twitter for postings) and with each purchase you earn other rewards like free coffees. I really love a place that loves it's customers like Smelly Cat does.
The atmosphere is very relaxed, and the baristas are very friendly! The shop is small and a little cramped but they have seating outside as well.

I was exploring the NODA area and came across this coffee shop on Yelp. The name stuck out as it reminded me of the show Friends so I decided to check it out. It's a quaint coffee shop that was conveniently located next to a small farmer's market. They offer three size options for hot coffee beverages - starting at 8 ounces. I ordered the Dirty Chai with almond milk. It is the best Dirty Chai I've had to date. The espresso didn't taste burnt and mixed well with the chai mix used. They also have a rewards program which is nice. I believe I was auto-enrolled when I swiped my credit card. If I am ever back in the area, I will be back!

Not my cup of tea. I get tea lattes and it blows my mind how unfamiliar some coffee places are with these. Anyway, I ordered, super nice people and all, but the tea latte wasn't that great. It was like warm when I got it which I don't know how since I got it straight away, and there was like, zero foam. What's a latte without foam? They also don't have stevia or my lesser choice, Splenda. My husband got the vanilla cappuccino. It was good, but very sweet. You know, sometimes you get a cappuccino more espresso tasting, and others more sweet? Well this one was the latter. The hubby was also treated to their fruity pebbles marshmallow treat. I'm not a fan of rice crispy treats, but I am a fan of fruity pebbles! This was a chunk of sugar rush that did not let me down! As the name suggests, there is something dying in there. It smells bad of you get the whiff. I don't like it. It's a cool, funky spot though to hang out and you can't be in there without thinking about Friends.

Good coffee and they have BEER! This place is unique; it has a very artsy vibe.

Generally much better coffee than Starbucks, Caribou and Dilworth coffee.

Wonderful coffee and espresso, great staff and very down to earth. Barista's are friendly and have a passion for their art but are not egotistical which is rare. Wish there was more lighting and better seating but over all wonderful experience!

I love Smelly Cat.  They are not only a coffee shop but a roaster as well.  If you can catch them on a roasting day, the smell is fabulous!  Kathy, the owner, is super friendly as is the rest of the staff and the coffee and pastries do not disappoint.  It's conveniently located in NoDa on the corner of N. Davidson and 36th.  If you're catching lunch at Boudreaux's or grabbing some beer at Salud, follow up with a locally roasted (usually organic) cup-a-joe at Smelly Cat.

Oh, and despite the name, there are no smelly cats anywhere to be seen.  This isn't a cat cafe.  Yes, those exist.

I am SO shocked to know I haven't reviewed this place yet. I probably go here most out of any other coffee shop! And always for their chai. Their chai is so good, it beats Amelie's chai's butt. As does their hot chocolate, yum! They used to carry really yummy Italian sodas and ice creams but stopped it. 
The highlight of this place is their outdoor seating on a beautiful day, but even the inside is cute and cozy. My favorite thing to do on a weekend morning is to get a cup of chai at Smelly and walk down N. Davidson looking at the quaint little shops. 
However nothing beats hanging out here on Friday and Saturday nights until 12am during warmer months.
The latte! Just wow. I'm in love with their homemade syrups! I mean the latte was FULL of flavor!! I'd didn't have to add ANYTHING! Can't wait to come back.
Yummy double shot mocha! Friendly staff in hipster section of town.........glad I found this place. I heart this place and would hang out here more often if I lived in NC!

though i buy starbucks alot, i love these non-chain cute coffee-shops! decent selection of beverages.  i've only tried the iced mocha and it was good.  Wish I was in town a little longer so i could sit in the cafe and get some work done!

Great coffee, great service, underrated loyalty program. Very convenient. 

Only negative, once saw the owner (manager?) yell at the staff in front of all the customers. Lots of turnover, but the staff is very good.

I absolutely love this quaint coffee shop. I've come here multiple times to work on papers for school and every staff member has been so friendly towards me. I asked if they would pour single glasses of wine and they gladly gave me a generous pour of some delicious red wine. I told them I was working on a big final paper and they asked me how I was doing with genuine curiosity. Totally recommend this place!

First off, I'm fully in support of independent coffee shops. I won't lie: I love Starbucks for its consistency and quality drinks. But sometimes you just need to leave the corporate behind and support local businesses. 

I wanted to love Smelly Cat--I really did. (Come on, what's not to love about the name?) And from all the good reviews, I had high expectations. I don't at all consider myself a snob, but it just wasn't my scene. Rustic is nice, but Smelly Cat could have stepped up the decor just a tad. 

The coffee house reminded me of a dive bar. That's not a terrible thing though, right? So, my impression was that I'd at least get a reasonably priced drink. However, I was taken back to find out that a small flavored iced latte would cost me $5.  Whoa...I didn't realize that ice cubes were that hot of a commodity in Charlotte. So I immediately backtracked my order and went with a frappe instead. It tasted alright, though it was on the rich side.

I will give Smelly Cat a thumbs up though for its indoor and outdoor seating. There's definitely plenty of space to chill out and enjoy your food and beverages. Oh, and did I mention they sell beer? I didn't try it, but kudos for that.

Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat thanks for providing me with a comfy booth and tasty treats. And yes, I'm that tool who sings the Smelly Cat song in my head every single time I walk into this cute little coffee house. 

Smelly Cat is one of those adorable local coffee hangouts that is chock full of fun. They have coffee, they have ice cream, they have pastries, they have tea...I mean, comon' they even have cheesecake. The staff have always been really friendly and eager to please. Hubs and I have strolled in here a few times during Friday gallery crawls and have yet to be disappointed. 

I've enjoyed a very good, and very sweet, white mocha. No doubt it would put most folks straight into sugar shock. On another occasion I've taken down a hefty strawberry croissant. While it wasn't at the caliber of other local bakeries, it was still flaky and scrumptious. I also remember a time that I enjoyed some type of mango iced tea. Even unsweetened it was the perfect accompaniment to a sweltering summer day. 

Until next time, Smelly Cat, I'm going to try to get this song out of my head now.
Their shakes are insanely good, maybe even better than their coffee, which is superb as well.

Man, I miss living in NoDa. Count this place as one of the 59384759 reasons why.

I use to live a few blocks away on Yadkin, so Smelly Cat became one of my second homes. You may have seen me riding around there as a passenger in Gman's golf cart. We are former roomies. Hi Greg.

Coffee, hot chocolate, tea... hot, cold. Whatevs. It's all fantastic. I was excited to have a meeting with Nathan B. over there today and reunite with my coffee shop. We were successfully productive despite a whole lot of eye candy visiting Smelly Cat this morning. Meow. See what I did there.

In a hurry? Grab a cup to go. Looking for a place to post up and get some work done? Make yourself at home and fire up the laptop. Make sure to snag a baked good, too. 

The workers at Smelly Cat are super friendly. They pretty much know everyone (if not actually everyone) in the 'hood. Plenty of parking in the SC lot and also on the street. Easily accessible. 

If you're in or nearby NoDa, be sure to stop by and get your caffeine fix here.
Amazing service. Amazing drinks. Highly recommend it. Loved the drinks and games and it was a great place to hang out
Great service and great advice on different types of cold brew. Great a selection of coffee and cold brews.

4.5 stars
What kind of coffee place doesn't recycle? Is this a new thing?

Recycling aside,  Smelly Cat was the perfect place for some caffeine fortification before the return leg of a road trip. Ended up with a frappe with an extra shot of espresso, and it was lovely and tasty. The dirty chai gets a lot of press, but I love my classics. Parking is free for two hours (put your receipt on the dash!)

I assume that this is named for Smelly Cat of Phoebe of Friends fame (maybe they should have Friends reruns playing? too blatant?), and it's a lovely little coffee shop with plenty of comfy seating and knick knacks and decor that you'd expect from a local little hipster-ish coffee shop. This is totally the kind of coffee shop I would hang out in to catch up with an old friend, or to solo write or read. Busy, cosy, but not too crazy.

Side note: They ran out of whipped cream while fixing my friend Kristen B's frappe and I was as put out as a five year old who doesn't get rainbow sprinkles on her sundae. However, they said I could come back for it in a few, and they totally did when I came back for it later!
Best dirty chai ever.  Excellent staff and a delicious beverages.  Just an overall enjoyable coffee experience.

Definitely in love with Smelly Cat, I work down the street so I come up here quite often. They are friendly and fast. Great customer service. Their coffee is great, it's fresh and smooth, perfect roast. Their lattes are delicious and creamy even with non-dairy. I love that their iced beverages are made with crushed ice. I also get their teas, smoothies and snacks and have always been satisfied.

This local coffee shop is the typical indie joint to grab a brew (coffee or beer). Every town has to have one, and Smelly Cat fits right into the Charlotte artsy district.

There is a lot of unique decor, it is located in a cool hipster district, and well... it is just totally what you expect! There are fresh baked goods offered, and alcohol, and lots of coffee choices. Also, there is ample comfortable seating and free wi-fi.

My decaf was pretty good, though slightly less hot than I would like. Regardless, the atmosphere is half of what makes a coffee shop great.

SC is friendly, and it is a solid place to sit down and enjoy your morning or afternoon with something to drink or eat. This joint really has the typical cool coffee shop thing down. Check it out if you want a hip, trendy place to bring your friends.
What a fun enjoyable place to come to.  I came here one morning grabbed a coffee (which was delish) and muffin and sat outside (there is some great people watching which is an added bonus).

This is, so far, my favorite coffee shop in town. Comfy, good coffee, great prices and nice staff. I also like it that they work with Yelp because when I checked in I got a nice surprising discount just for checking in. I will be returning often and will also try catch some of the events they offer. The tomato soup is delicious! Too bad that there is not much seating inside, but it is not something to complain about as it provides an intimate atmosphere at the same time. Love it!!

The coffee shop is the only shop in town that offers their own roasting on premises. They have a giant contraption that they roast the green beans into what you're used to putting in your coffee grinder. 
The coffee was delicious, a citrus raspberry taste with a light roast. 
They also offered plenty of samples of their baked goods, which tasted amazing. I was happy to see that they offer real milk and cream, instead of the non-dairy creamer stuff. 
There were plenty of places to sit and relax, play one of their games, or read one of their books. They offered lots of free literature at the front and back of the bar. 
The staff was very welcoming and friendly, and the prices were quite reasonable for the high quality of coffees they're serving.

Only $3 for a 12 oz Chai Tea Latte? Yes please. Absolutely fantastic. It's not hard to beat Starbucks' version, but they knocked it out of the park.

Comfortable, unique atmosphere; friendly, smiling faces; beautiful outdoor patio space.

Smelly Cat was recommended by a friend, so my Wife and I are gave them a visit while we were in NODA. We like the fru-fru coffee drinks and usually go to Starbucks. I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised. I had a almond milk mocha w/toasted coconut and it was probably the best cup of coffee I have had in quite a while. It was also a little cheaper than Starbucks. I will definately be visiting more often. Fresh Roasted Beans, a Nice Staff, and a Fair Price. I would definitely recommend it to my friends.

Staple coffee place for NoDa. They have some of the best coffee (and really good apple cider) in Charlotte. The staff here is always really friendly and helpful.

Inside the coffee show is pretty cozy. They have a few tables, some nooks if you want to be secluded or some comfy chairs. There's not a lot of seating inside, but there's more on the outside. 

Great place to grab a coffee and get some work done (free wifi of course) !
Great place to chill on the patio. Good location makes it easy for a casual morning walk to enjoy coffee.
Love the vibe of this place. Never been disappointed except with parking options.  Coffee is delicious and the atmosphere is inviting.
Five stars for quality of coffee and service! Awesome coffee shop with high quality stuff and good prices

First time here. It was decent coffee but there's better in Charlotte. The breakfast biscuit burrito was good. A little overpriced imo but overall pretty good. Staff was extremely friendly so that's a huge plus. It's in a great location as well!
This coffee shop is so cute. I don't live in Charlotte anymore, but it's one of my favorite spots for whenever I'm back in town. Frozen dirty chai is amazing!

How can you not love a coffee shop named as a direct homage to the show Friends? Well, whatever they are feeding Smelly Cat, it must be fantastic! See what I did there?

Smelly Cat is well-placed in NoDa, and a perfect pit stop on the way to NoDa Eclectic Marketplace on Saturdays.Smelly Cat is pretty small inside, so getting a table can certainly be challenging and encountering a line is not an uncommon experience. But, that dirty chai though is well-worth the hassles.

Best coffee in Charlotte!  This little gem is in the heart of NoDa.  The coffee is amazing, the owners keep it upbeat and fun. 

There is a great selection of breakfast sandwiches that are fresh made in the back, and delicious fresh muffins. 

There is free wifi, you just have to request the password of the week. 

It's a great place to do some work during the week, meet friends, or just relax on a Sunday.

In town visiting and found this cute local place. Hands down very iced coffee I've ever had. Strongly recommend the Vietnemese Blend. And wow was it strong. Don't drink on an empty stomach! Employees were super nice and welcoming.

My go-to place for my morning pick me up when I work in the neighborhood. Coffee is always fresh, they have almond milk (which is a big plus from someone who doesn't drink soy) and the staff is always super friendly and welcoming. The bagels and their herb cream cheese are made in house and are to die for. If you're in the area, definitely worth the try.

Best coffee is found in hipster coffeeshops and this is a great hipster coffeeshop!

They have free wifi which makes it great to study/get some work done. They have both indoor and outdoor seating.
I love the atmosphere. It's warm and cozy ad the perfect place for a nice warm drink and relaxation. Love the chai latte. Prices are good, friendly service. I will be back.

We were in town to see if we want to move to Charlotte. We visited a few coffee places and I was afraid I wouldn't find one that fit. I was wrong . This place is awesome from service to the quality of the teas and espresso. The baristas were so nice when we had questions about where to go and what to do in the city. Just a fantastic find!

Love it here! We stumbled upon the place a few years ago while our friends were showing us around Noda and last month we were delighted to revisit. The coffee is gourmet deliciousness, the staff is knowledgeable and the decor is kitschy. Can't wait to go back.

Awesome staff!!!!! We were traveling through. They gave me tasting of a few coffee types since I usually only drink tea but when in Rome. I found a delicious one! They make all breakfast items in house. We had quiche and egg/cheese burrito yummy. We also got coffee cake muffins and water for the road. The atmosphere is eclectic and groovy. A must see. If your traveling through make the effort to hop off I-85 and enjoy it. You will not be disappointed. They have outside seating also. A small parking area on each side of building and street parking. Did I say awesome staff oh yeah but I'm sayin it again! Great job guys. GROOT loves you!

Awesome little coffee shop with beautiful design. The mural in the bathroom is beautiful!

I had a dirty chai frappe... Delish!!!!  Can't wait to try it again, next trip to Charlotte!

Best name for a coffee shop too, totally reminded me of a much cooler Friends Central Perk :)

Super cute coffee shop with tasty beverages.  I'm no coffee connoisseur, but the coffee here is quite good.  I've been heading there to get a little work done on Sundays around midday, and there's a nice diverse crowd of people chatting, working, and grabbing to go drinks or food.  Cyclists stop by during the morning ride, and people walk their dogs up for a little morning caffeine. The atmosphere is very hipster and cool, but not oppressively so. Sunday mornings (I don't know what other days) they have hot breakfast items- biscuits, burritos and the like which are pretty good.  There is also a case of baked goods, but I haven't sampled those yet.  Overall, I will be returning for more coffee and chill time.

I'm not a coffee drinker but I ended up here on a food tour. It's such a cute place. The decor is nice and there's actually plenty of small tables for lingering despite the small space. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable about the products and the beans are all roasted in house. While others in my food tour tried the Colombian coffee, I tried mango iced tea. They also had really delicious no bake treats! Stop in!

Am usually not a coffee person... but yest we had some time to while awa and tot vll check out this coffee shop...though the name doesn appeal at all, i must say for a change i enjoyed drinking coffee..ordered a cappuccino without any added flavor...it smelled good..and tasted nice!!
also picked up their house made muffins...a craneberry orange muffin..it was delicious...actually pieces of fruit to bite on...i loved it. the ambience is also nice for some one to just sit and read or listen to some music while enjoying a good cup of coffee.
Great coffee shop.  Service was quick and friendly.  Coffee was great.  The space is a little tight and we ended up sitting outside.  Highly recommend and we'll visit again.
I normally stick to Starbucks but this place was a good change for fresh brewed Coffee and great snacks.

So I've probably passed this place a thousand times since moving to Charlotte and finally stopped to see what the good ole smelly cat hype was about. It's a little vibrant coffee shop located in the Noda area. I'm a huge iced coffee fan but I thought ahhhh what the heck I'll step out of the box today. I tried a iced vanilla latte with almond milk and it was okay. You have to have an acquired taste to drink them but they were really good but much different taste from a iced coffee to clarify. The young lady behind the counter was super nice and helpful. Even let me sample a few things! Loved there outdoor seating and the fact that it has shade so I can still sit outside and enjoy a nice book even in June 90 degree weather. I'd definitely say try it out they offer more than just lattes!

Came looking for a good local coffee shop and this place delivered. The place is kinda small so come at a good time and you'll get a seat--but I have no complains about the quality of the coffee. The atmosphere is very relaxing and NoDa (the area it's located in) is a nice spot as well! A good central location and now my local favorite.
Cute coffee shop. Not much seating inside but more seating outside if the weather is nice enough. Yummy iced chai latte.

I absolutely adore this little coffee shop. After drinking their vanilla lattes I would pick this over Starbucks anyday! All if the staff are such sweethearts and super quirky and fun, it is in such a good location in NoDa. It's one of my favorite places to go just to type up a paper and have a coffee or chi tea.
Quaint and cozy coffee shop with friendly staff. Coffee was tasted great and they had a small selection of pastries/muffins. Great outdoor space too. This place has a great vibe about it.

As a FRIENDS fanatic how could I not like a place called "Smelly Cat"?  (does literally everyone write that in their opening line *rolling eyes at self*)...hee hee hee :)

A cute little place. Repeat TINY. Would love this place as a solo-venture or even with the hubby but with kids in tow...nada in NODA. The black drip coffee was decent. I opted for the black dark organic roast. Thumbs up. Took a sip of husband's medium roast and it was crazy bitter. However he says he enjoyed it so there you go. ;) As far as gluten free they had a delightful peanut butter bar; stole a few bites from the kids and it was sugary delightfulness. Very rich. Anywho. Super cute place. Enjoyed seeing NODA and cannot wait to get back to the neighborhood to try out some of the food and culture fare.

Okay yes they didn't have a burrito for breakfast but at least the biscuits were really good! The place is tiny but great and the coffee very unique and nothing like Starbucks. 

Worth the trip to see the artwork and catch the great vibes of NODA . I can see why this place is a local favorite. Plus who can't stop thinking about Friends when they hear this name! I like it because it is an experience. Enjoy!

I'm from Chicago in Charlotte area for an internship. I google 'best hot chocolate in Charlotte' and Smelly Cat pops up. I gotta say they were right. It is the best hot chocolate I've ever had and I came back to try the Chai cause they told me it was good. And it was just as good as the hot chocolate. Before I go back home, I'll be stopping in for some hot chocolate and some chai to take home with me.

Awesome coffee shop. Went there to start our date night. We got a Sweet New Orleans cold brew and my bride got the spiced brown sugar latte. We also got a slice of the zucchini bread and a morning glory muffin. Super tasty. We will be back.
Breakfast burrito was tasty and fresh! Coffee was a bit sour for my taste. Great atmosphere!
Great locally roasted coffee.   Convenient to UNC Charlotte.  Friendly, coffee savvy staff.

I am still not sure if this coffee shop is an ode to Phoebe from Friends or not- but I can't help but sing her song in my head every time I walk through the door. 
Their staff are always so friendly, like family, really. From bold roasts to teas, it's all top notch. 
Post up in one of their booth nooks, perfect for the remote worker; grab a seat in the red chairs out front and enjoy some sunshine, or snatch a table table at the bar and spectate the people walking by.

We went here after KIDaween at The Neighborhood Theater this past weekend and I've been here once before several months ago. It's a pretty cool place with a lot of personality. The coffee is good, I just had a regular, dark roast coffee and Becky had tea. KIDaween gave each one of The Little Kids a coupon for free ice cream which we redeemed.

The staff was awesome, friendly and professional. The girls at the counter were very nice to the kids and asked about KIDaween.

The set up is quaint and artsy as it should be in NoDa and there's a nice balance of NoDa natives and families filling the tables.

Love the community board (but I have a weird thing for those) and the little outside area.

Definitely will stop by again.

I fell in love with this coffee shop from the name itself, reminded me of how much I miss the TV show Friends. 

I tried the Sledgehammer ($3.75)- espresso with Giradelli dark chocolate, it was pure happiness. Totally recommend if you like bitter coffee and dark chocolate. It's a little 4oz shot but I wish they served it in a big cup. The other coffee options looked great and interesting as well. They also have a few beers available in bottles.

It's a great place for a coffee date, chilling with friends and to study (FREE wifi, yay). It has both outdoor as well as indoor seating available. If I lived around, you would definitely see me here every week.

The servers are really friendly and helpful. Definitely recommend trying this place.

They have good coffee that is undoubtable, but the interior is not set up for an ergonomic study area. The seats are hard and uncomfortable, the place is too dark (think throwback to 2000's Abercrombie dark), and the music is unbearably loud. Stopped in after hearing so many good things from people, but definitely not a convert. Might be great to grab a cup of Coffee and talk with a friend, but go elsewhere if you are trying to get work done.

Love the chunky monkey, a frappe with a banana and chocolate blended in. So yummy!

The atmosphere is a true "coffee house" with great tunes and workstations with privacy and outlets. 

A great noda treasure!

I can't get enough of their amazing iced chai Latte and dirty chai Latte! hopefully one of these days, I'll get to try something else off of their amazingly extensive menu. They're probably the only place (or may be one of very few coffee shops in town) that serves cortados! and if you're not in the mood for caffeine, you can have beer, wine or ice cream instead. I wish they had better food options; it would be nice to have a fresh croissant with the coffee :) 
the staff is wonderful and friendly. I've found that the ambiance in there is a reflection of the staff's mood.. late on a Saturday morning, it can get loud with chatter and music, and then there are times when it's quiet enough to get some reading done. They're a bit pricey to be my every morning coffee stop, but not at all a bad option for my weekend coffee fix.. 
you can pay by cash, card or Square (pretty hip huh ;) )

I love this little place with all my soul. Super cute. Super quaint. Personalized and hipster fresh. Ordered the toasted coconut latte. Yum! House made syrups! Yum! Place is kinda small and it's a little cold to utilize the outdoor seating but I could totally see myself coming to this place everything to retreat. I'm not from charlotte but of the 4 shops I've tried while I've been visiting, this by far is my fav. If you love super unique places. Try it!

Smelly Cat C/H is in NoDa...and as the NoDa quest it is neighborly, and with an artsy flair. It is VERY tiny, and dark indoors, and there are a few tables & chairs outside. The 2 baristas, one male/one female, were both attentive, friendly & helpful in my choosing what to drink...it was my 1st visit there. The price of coffee was shockingly REASONALBE...YES! Smelly Cat was extremely CLEAN and tidy...something that is important to me. If I lived IN NoDa, I bet I'd become a 'regular' at The Cat. It's a good place to know about in that part of town to meet friends and clients, too. I only saw cookies/pastries to eat, but I was there in the evening and was more concerned with cleanliness than food choices (just being honest). I WILL return and use The Cat as a regular meeting place when in NoDa.
Only possible 'con' is IF you use artificial sweetener, BRING YOUR OWN, as smelly cats do NOT use artificials...sorry but I have lived well on 'PINK" now 61 yrs and never treated even ONE patient in 38 yr of ER Medicine who was ill from using 'PINK'. I'll be stashing a few in my car starting now.

Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, what are they feeding you?!  Ha!!  Aside from the Friends reference, I can offer a great review.  I thoroughly enjoy coming here for a tasty cup of brew.  I really think the vibe has changed since they took out their on-site roaster; bring it back.  Don't get me wrong, it's still a cool place. 

One of my favorite things about this place is that they make their own syrup flavorings.  I normally get vanilla syrup added to my coffee and it is phenomenal.  They have plenty of food options, but let me warn you.... I got a cheese biscuit and it was like eating rubber.  It was so bad I had to throw it out.  They should rethink their biscuit preparation.   

Service is always fun and friendly. Parking is horrible, and there are not enough seat for dining in.   They really have outgrown this location.   Go check them out, but be prepared to park and walk!!

Great service from attentive baristas who have not learned to burn coffee like Starbucks, and also fail to give a convincing apathetic attitude to suggest they are only doing this until their art sells to a generous patron.  In fact, Smelly Cat has easy off street parking in a fashionable neighborhood, and is an enjoyable place with good bakery items.  They may learn to be disappointing someday, but for now they actually measure up.  Get there soon, or don't.  Then I will get more coffee.
Some of the best coffee I've ever had. The best coffee place in Charlotte and the Carolinas. Great vibe. Cool looking.
Over all good. But deff not the best chai I've ever had...

Smelly Cat is a cute little cafe right in the heart of NoDa. The cafe is right across the street from some bad a** new condos and apartments! You couldn't ask for a better location! 

Environment: I love the way that they use repurposed materials to decorate their space.  When repurposed materials are used for decorating, you really have to have an eye for what goes together well  and Smelly Cat did it well! You walk in and you see booths made out of reclaimed wood and old doors, exposed brick, and duct work. They have free Wi-Fi and outlets to plug in your laptop and phone. The place is cozy, functional, and visually interesting. There is also outdoor seating. They are coveted so good luck. We drank our coffee at the bar facing the window and scored outdoor seating as soon as some people left!
