Service: Very Friendly! The barista explained the different options including the many food options, various brews, and their homemade syrups. 

Coffee: Great! I followed the advice of some of my fellow Yelpers and ordered the dirty chai over ice. It was creamy, sweet, and delicious! 

There is a parking lot that isn't that far from the cafe. It was reasonable and a short walk. 

I enjoyed my visit to Smelly Cat!

Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, 
What are they feeding you? 
Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, 
It's not your fault 

Now, I am going to be 110% honest here, the reason my fiance and I ventured to Smelly Cat is because we just moved to the area and WE LOVE Friends. When we found out there was a coffee shop in town and that's down the road from us named Smelly Cat, it was a no-brainer. So, we jumped on our bikes and the story beings.

WOW! Everyone and their Mom comes here. We visited Smelly Cat on a Sunday and I was nervous with the Farmer's Market next door and a number of dogs that we wouldn't be able to find a place to sit, but we did! 

All of their breakfast items are homemade, so if you get there late don't be surprised if that breakfast burrito you wanted is no longer there. Yuuup, that's what happened to us. Our barista pointed us in the right direction and we settled for a breakfast sandy with sausage, egg and cheese. I am pretty sure the biscuit is what made this sandy from meh to yum! 

Iced coffee lovers, this is your spot. With four, maybe five, different types of cold brew on draft. I don't see the problem. I went with the New Orleans style cold brew and I should have asked for more information. This was far too sweet for my likening, but now you know.

This is my favorite coffee in Charlotte. It's usually easy to park, casual vibe. It's very hipstery, in a good way. They have a really pretty roaster, and I've seen them roasting their own coffee right on the premises. They have a baked goods, often began options, veggie chili, breakfast biscuits in the mornings. There is also a case that has a couple beer options. I can't think of anything else.
Second time coming here. They let me sample each cold brew and pick out the cold brew I enjoyed the most. The in-house one was up to par!

We went in for the name and free wi-fi.  We stayed a while because of the awesome vibe.  Smelly Cat is in the fun NoDa neighborhood.  There were 80's tunes playing when we arrived, local art on the walls, and excellent re-purposing of old shabby chic doors to form - I don't know what to call them - maybe table cubicles?  The doors divide space between tables along the walls.  What a great way to create semi-privacy.  I've never seen that done before, so major snaps for creativity.

Loved the concrete coffee bar and exposed industrial ceiling.  Smelly Cat is ultra hip.  Oh, with good coffee, by the way.

I used to go in a lot with my friends last year, and always really enjoyed the shop! And now I hear, free wifi? Their drinks are awesome, their goodies are yummy, and some are gluten free! (Which means I can eat them! xD) They have really slushy ice, which is awesome because it is like snow, and I'm the weird kid who put out a bowl for snow to fall in every year so I could have 'natural' snow cones. The baristas are always friendly, and nice, even if you just want a cup of ice. I will definitely have to make my way over for some caffeine buzz, and free wifi to do my homework. Awesome shop with an even better atmosphere, definitely recommend it!

Excellent coffee house!  I had espresso (latte) which was wonderful....not bitter at all!   I hate Starbucks and coming here and experiencing a real coffee shop where there is a quality product was awesome!   We need more of these places in Charlotte!   My hubby had Cafe au lait which he said was delicious and he's not even a huge coffee person.   The ambience of the place is great to hang out in and just chill or enjoy with friends!

This is my new spot for Sunday afternoon coffee! A large cappuccino, a spot at the coffee bar and relaxing atmosphere is where it's at. On a hot summer day, I saw just about everyone ordering one of the many flavors of frapps. Can't wait to see what this place has in store for upcoming fall season...lets hope it'll put the Starbucks pumpkin spice latte to shame!
Where NoDa wakes up. Excellent coffee. Nice outdoor seating. Wishing I'd come for cocktails last night.

Best coffee in NODA and in the top few in the city.  The shop is small and has a steampunk kind of vibe.  Nice outdoor seating on three sides of the building too.  Great coffee with a limited amount of pastries that are good if you want a bite to eat.  The farmers market takes place saturday mornings in their parking lot.  A coffee and some of the goods in the market make a wonderful start to the day.  The staff is really friendly and work quickly.

***  I live in the middle of NODA and have been everywhere in the neighborhood many times over the past years. These reviews are a culmination of lots of visits so it's more of a consistency rating than anything.  If you are going out in NODA I've got reviews up of all the places in the neighborhood if you're looking to compare.  ***

Went here on a quick trip to Charlotte and loved it. The atmosphere is welcoming and there is ample indoor and outdoor seating. The baristas were kind and knowledgeable, and my latte was tasty! If you are looking for a unique local coffee shop in Charlotte, this is your place!
One of my favorite coffee shops. Favorite drinks are dirty chai, caramel latte, and white mocha. Two problems: close very early Monday's and Tuesday's, and not nearly enough seating inside.

I will never forget you delicious iced chai! So good. 

It's a fun and quirky coffee shop, that has delicious chai, what more can you ask for? Maybe a dirty chai, with a shot of espresso?? And pumpkin rolls in June? I'm in! Although I wasn't as into the roll as much as the chai, it's still a solid shop in my book.
Slow but friendly service. Excellent chai latte. Relaxed and comfortable atmosphere.

Just sitting here getting ready to leave. I came here to get out of the house to study -- however this is not the spot (well for me). Having a lot of technical terminology to learn - the distractions here were  worse than my dogs. 

But for a coffee shop to chill and surf the web --- this is a great place. The music selection overhead was perfect, the ambiance is cozy, the counter staff professional and with smiles. 

I ordered a non-fat cap and it was velvety, smooth, and delish. The beans they use are roasted to perfection. 

I will have to check out the Smelly Cat again when my brain is not required. 

Thanks for the Java Jolt Smelly Cat!

The Smelly Cat was great. They have a very bright and fun decor; outside seating; and a big set of rocking chairs. How can you go wrong with rocking chairs? 

The barista made my hot chocolate with milk instead of water and put a nice serving of whipped cream on top. The young man who served us was extremely friendly, genuine, patient, and hard-working... and quite cute to boot. 

The cafe is in the NoDa neighborhood (North of Davidson), a two-block assemblage of eateries, alternative shops, a concert venue, etc. It seems to be the only area in Charlotte that doesn't suck. The only problem is that many of the places around are closed on Monday-Wednesday nights.

This is our first time here and we had two fantastic almond milk lattes. Breakfast burrito was also good. Most of all the place is just a great coffee house atmosphere - - comfortable inviting... Just an overall good vibe!

One of my personal favorite coffee shops in Charlotte. Located in the heart of NoDa, parking can be a little tricky--but they do have a small lot next to the building.

It's a quirky joint in everything from it's name to its interior design, and it attracts all kinds of customers. I think we all have a universal appreciation for the "Friends" love. 

The coffee is great, they have multiple options to choose from and they have baked goods and breakfast options to enjoy with your drink! 

I recommend sticking to the basics: black coffee with a bacon, egg and cheese biscuit sandwich, you won't regret it!

Very neat and unique coffee house with cute seating inside and out. They have a roaster inside, and have yummy baked goods. 

They also sell merchandise with their logo!
Since they started roasting their own coffee, I take back my so-so review from before and give Smelly Cat a no-charity rating of 4 stars.

Chunky monkey! Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!
Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!

Holy sheet! Order this tasty thang called a chunky monkey! Wish I visited Charlotte more often....blows atl coffee away























Pst......did I mention  Chunky monkey!

Great spot.My fav kind of coffee pub.went there this morning after show last night across the street at Neighborhood Theatre(another great venue!)
Friendly staff.Great espresso.Fair pastry,but I didn't go there for the pastry!
Next time I'm in Charlotte, I'll hit up the Cat!

I think this is the best coffee shop in Charlotte. My personal favorite is their Vietnamese coffee (with a flavor shot), but everything I have ever had from there has been phenomenal. Their chai comes in at a VERY close second. Charming location. Great outdoor seating. They also offer a small menu of desserts, soups, etc. This place is a must stop every time we are in the area.

I love smelly cat coffee! This is one of my favorite coffee shops, for sure in Charlotte, but may be of all times. I love the nostalgic feel inside and the seating outside. The variety of drinks makes this hole in the wall a special place to visit.

Sometimes parking can be a problem on the weekends, but if you don't mind a stroll, you can easily find parking up and down the street.

If you come hungry, don't worry! Their breakfast burritos are cheap and fantastic!

Great iced chai latte.  Love the atmosphere of this place... very cozy and personal.  The artwork on the walls and also all the fllyers of the "what's happening" in the NoDa scene are great conversation starters as well as just keeping up with the local art scene.

In my last visit I noticed chess boards and checkers on the shelf which you can play with... not plastic/cheapo sets, but sets with character... wood with metal pieces.  I bet there are more games, but I only saw these in passing.

Staff was super friendly and my latte was unique tasting (in a good way).

Wandered into this shop after landing in Charlotte at 7am. It was the only place open as I wandered NoDa, but I'm so glad I found my way to Smelly Cat. The dirty chai is the best I've had. So good, I went back the next day for the same thing. Plenty of outdoor seating when the weather's nice. Make sure to stop by on Saturday for the NoDa Farmer's Market!

The best Chai Tea Latte I've ever had! My friend and I came here maybe a month or two ago. It was my second time, her first time, so we asked for a good recommendation. The girl who helped us was very sweet and welcomed us, and mentioned that their Chai Tea Latte was pretty tasty. Chai Tea Latte's are one of my favourite drinks and so of course I wanted to give this one a try. My friend and I both ordered one, and when one of the staff members brought it to us at our table (which was also really nice!), we were both really impressed! We will definitely come back here. 
The atmosphere was very cozy and welcoming.
Board games are available for you to play with whoever you happen to be with!.
We brought our own deck of cards so we played that for a while and a group behind us was playing a Harry Potter board game! Felt like I was at a peaceful family get together. Haha! 
All in all a really great experience - I've recommended this to basically all of my friends. 
The location is wonderful as well! Easy to just step out and walk around NoDa area and explore a bit.

When you want to stick it to the man (Starbucks) this is definitely a great option. The staff is friendly and almost all of them live locally so they're enjoyable to chat with and simply be around.

They recently have begun roasting their own coffee beans which adds a freshness and death to the coffee like I have never experienced before. 

Don't forget that they also offer wine and beer as well as a discount for beer when you check in with yelp.

However, the selling point for me is definitely that they except Square... So load them up in your Square Wallet and put it on your tab so you can feel like you're already a regular your first time visiting.

The atmosphere that Smelly Cat provides is a great additional experience to exploring the NODA area in Charlotte. I've been living in Charlotte for a year and this was my first experience of coming here. The coffee taste great, it gets crowded but doesn't feel suffocating, and the staff are really good. A place that I would definitely recommend if you're in the area. Enjoy Smelly Cat!

Met some friends here for coffee on a Wednesday morning and loved it. Went back again today for another cold brewed, iced coffee. 

Great decor (very funky) and I love to sails they use to give shade on the front patio. I would have locked a little something to eat but the baked goods weren't that appealing. I did buy a couple bags of coffee for home though. 

If you're in NoDa and appreciate excellent coffee, stop by the Smelly Cat!

Came in for open mic night.
Wasn't a great night.
But its a cute shop, and the coffee was real good.
The parking is a pain, but its like that no matter where you go around here.

Excellent prices and excellent coffee. Not as gourmet a cup as what the coffee scientists at Hex coffee near Dilworth deliver, but still damn good. Also, the place itself and the area is really cool so consider a walk around if you aren't from Charlotte like me!
